children.definition: shrink from, c. inf., ὅπως . . μὴ κατοκνήσεις κτανεῖν Αἴγισθον S. El. 956; κ. ὀρθοῦσθαι Hp. Mochl. 20; κ. γῆν περιιδεῖν τμηθεῖσαν Th. 2.18; μὴ κατόκνει . . πορεύεσθαι Isoc. 1.19: c. acc., τὴν στρατείαν App. Mith. 110: abs., shrink back, A. Pr. 67, Th. 2.94, Isoc. 6.75, D. 29.1, etc.; to be sluggish, εἰ τῇ δυνάμει κ. [ἡ ψυχή] Phld. Mus. p.30 K.
possession, τῆς χώρας Anon. ap. Suid.; mental grasp, τῶν εἰρημένων Zeno Stoic. 1.58.

children.label: II
children.definition: being possessed, inspiration, θείᾳ μοίρᾳ καὶ κατοκωχῇ Pl. Ion 536c; ἀπὸ Μουσῶν κ. Id. Phdr. 245a, cf. Ph. 1.174, al., Dam. Isid. 32:—the forms κατακωχή, -ιμος are late and incorrect; cf. ἀνοκωχή, συνοκωχή.
held in possession, held as a pledge, [ χωρίον] Is. 2.28 (vulg. κατόχιμον) ; τὸ κ. Hsch.

capable of being possessed by a feeling or passion, ὑπὸ κινήσεως Arist. Pol. 1342a8; ἐκ τῆς ἀρετῆς Id. EN 1179b9; τῷ πάθει possessed, Id. HA 572a32; inclined, πρός τι Id. Pol. 1269b30: abs., frantic, Luc. JTr. 30 (vulg. κατόχιμος).
neglect utterly, τοῦ δικαίου Lys. 9.16; [ ἀνδρός] Longin. 13.2, cf. Jul. Or. 1.2a:— Pass., SIG 888.153 ( Scaptopara, iii A.D.).
to be negligent, ἐν τοῖς ἀλλοτρίοις Diogenian. 2.75, cf. PSI 4.426.3 (iii B.C.); κατολιγωρήσαντες with contempt, Arist. Rh.Al. 1421a15.

definition: κατολισθάνω, later κατολισθ-αίνω Gal. 7.36, Agath. 1.1: Ep. aor. 2 κατόλισθε A.R. 1.390: aor. 1 - ωλίσθησα Alciphr. 3.64: pf. - ωλίσθηκα Orib. 50.42.3:—

children.definition: slip, sink down, Str. 4.6.6; of hernia, Gal. l.c.; of a building, collapse, Agath. 1.10: metaph., ἐς πάθος, εἰς ἔρωτα, Luc. Abd. 28, Alciphr. l.c.; εἰς τὸ βλάσφημον Ael. Fr. 60; εἰς πλεονεξίαν Agath. 1.1.
slipping down, Sor. 1.108, Gal. 19.447, Paul.Aeg. 6.65.
perish utterly, νεολαία . . κατὰ πᾶσʼ ὄλωλεν A. Pers. 670 (lyr.).
shriek over, θύματος A. Ag. 1118 (lyr.).
bewail, c.acc., E. IT 644 (lyr.), X. Cyr. 7.3.16; τινῶν τὸν βίον Diog.Oen. l.c.; κ. πολλὰ ἑαυτόν D.H. 5.12: abs., E. Or. 339 (lyr.).
to be rained on, Plb. 34.1.16, Str. 16.1.5: metaph., ὄμματα κατομβρηθέντα γόοισιν AP 7.389 ( Apollonid.).
heavy rain, Lyd. Ost. 30, al.: pl., ib. 58.
rainy, ἔτος Orph. Fr. 252.

definition: κατόμβριος, ον, = foreg., dub. l. in Ph. 2.515.

children.definition: Lyd. Ost. 40.
rainy, νότος Arist. Vent. 973b9; ἔαρ Gp. 1.12.24.

children.label: II
children.definition: wet with rain, drenched, Thphr. CP 3.12.1, 3.22.3: metaph., ὄμματʼ ἐρώντων AP 5.144 ( Asclep.).
confirm by oath, τινί τι Ar. Av. 444.
call to witness, swear by, τὴν ἐμὴν ψυχήν E. Or. 1517 (troch.), etc.; κ. τὼ θεώ Ar. Ec. 158: c. dupl. acc., ἁγνὸν ὅρκον σὸν κάρα κατώμοσα E. Hel. l.c.: c.gen., κ. τῆς κεφαλῆς Anon. ap. Suid.
swear, c. inf., IG 12(9).1273.1 ( Eretria, vi B.C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Med. = Act., tender an oath, Antipho Soph. Oxy. 1364.140, Arist. Rh. 1377a16, PMagd. 26.13 (iii B.C.); swear by, τοὺς θεούς Aristaenet. 2.20: c.acc. et inf., D. 39.4, cf. Paus. 6.18.3.
take an oath against, accuse on oath, Hdt. 6.65 (gen. as v.l.): abs., ib. 69.
wipe clean off, Hsch.
from the navel, v.l. for παρομφ-, Nic. Th. 290.
enjoy, in aor. 1, σαυτῆς κατόναιο Ar. Ec. 917 (lyr.); τέκνων, σπορῶν, καρπῶν, οὐσίας κατόνασθαι SIG 826 C 15 ( Delph., ii B.C.).

name, Str. 7.3.2, al.; ἀπό τινος ib. 13.1.48 (dub.l.):— Pass., ζωμὸς κατωνόμασται Anaxandr. 34.5; to be named, Arist. EE 1221b10, Thphr. Od. 2; to be expressed in terms, of numbers, Archim. Aren. 1.3; τὰ -ωνομασμένα the aforesaid, Meno Iatr. 11.33, Philum. Ven. 27.3.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., to be betrothed, c. dat., Plb. 5.43.1, Hsch. s.v. τᾶλις; to be devoted to the gods. D.H. 1.16, Phalar. Ep. 84.1.
censure bitterly, depreciate, abuse, c.acc., Hdt. 2.172: aor., μή με κατονοσθῇς πρὸς τὰς . . πυραμίδας ib. 136.
expression of numbers, Archim. Aren. 1.7 (prob.):—also κατονόμ-αξις, εως, ἡ, ib. 3.1.
name, denomination, Str. 1.2.34 (pl.).
named, Hdn. Epim. 203.
drenched with vinegar, over-sour, Posidipp. 1.7.
hasten on, τι Artemon Fr. 12.

definition: κάτοξυς, εια, υ, strengthd. for ὀξύς,

children.definition: very sharp, piercing, βοή Ar. V. 471; of disease, acute, Hp. Aph. 1.7 (cf. Gal. 18(2).254), Aret. SA 1.7, CA 1.10; τὸ κ. τῆς ὀρέξεως Hld. 1.26.
follow hard upon, tread on the heels of, αἰδῶ δέ τʼ ἀναιδείη κατοπάζῃ Hes. Op. 324.
POxy. 2146.8 (iii A.D.), Gloss.

behind, after, Hp. Mul. 1.12, Th. 4.32, X. Cyr. 1.4.21: c.gen., Ar. Eq. 625, Pl. Prt. 316a; κ. ἐπὶ τῷ στόλῳ Plb. 1.50.5; ἐκ τῶν κ. Id. 2.67.2: metaph., κ. χωρεῖν τῶν εἰργασμένων fall short of, fail in describing, Chor. p.23 B.[8.1.52]

children.label: II
children.definition: after, hereafter, f.l. in Thgn. 280; εὐθὺς κ. Thphr. HP 7.13.7; κ. ἑορτῆς ἥκομεν ‘too late for the fair’, Pl. Grg. 447a; ἡ κ. [ἡμέρα] Plb. 1.46.7, Phld. Ind.Sto. 19; ὁ κ. ἐνιαυτός Plu. Cam. 43; σε μένει καὶ κ. δάκρυα AP 9.70 ( Mnasalc.).

definition: κατόπισθεν, in Poets also -θε, Adv. of Place,

children.definition: behind, after, Il. 23.505, Od. 22.92: c.gen., 12.148, Pancrat. Oxy. 1085.14: metaph., of rank, ἁ δʼ Ἀρετὰ κ. θνατοῖς ἀμελεῖται E. IA 1093 (lyr.).

data.quote: ἁ δʼ Ἀρετὰ κ. θνατοῖς ἀμελεῖται

children.label: II
children.definition: hereafter, afterwards, henceforth, Od. 22.40, 24.546; ὁ κ. λογισμός Pl. Ti. 57e, cf. Thgn. 280; also κ. λιποίμην Od. 21.116, cf. Pl. R. 363d.
roast or bake thoroughly, Archestr. Fr. 13.6, Phld. D. 1.19, Str. 15.2.2, 16.4.13:— Pass., to be well baked, Arist. Aud. 802b2, 803a29; to be overheated, of the blood, Gal. 7.246.
spying, reconnoitring, J. AJ 18.9.7.

children.label: II
children.definition: Corp.Herm. 3.3 (- οπτία).
observation, Procl. Par.Ptol. 155, Gloss.:—also written καθόπτ-, ib.
fit for looking out, τὸ κ., = σκοπιά, Sch. E. Ph. 233.

spy out, ὠτακουστεῖν καὶ κ. v.l. for διοπτ- in X. Cyr. 8.2.10; observe closely, ἅπαντα, φύσιν ἀνθρώπων, Plb. 1.4.11, D.H. Lys. 7; reconnoitre, Plb. 3.45.3; of a night-policeman, POxy. 1033.13 (iv A.D.); visit, explore a country, Plb. 34.1.8, 34.5.9; τὸν οὐράνιον χῶρον Arist. Mu. 391a10; ἐπὶ τοῦ Πηγάσου τὸν οὐρανόν Asclep.Myrl. ap. Sch. Il. 6.155; κ. ἐς . . AP 5.122 ( Phld.):— Pass., Plb. 3.37.11, Str. 2.4.6; to be observed, S. Aj. 829; μὴ κατοπτευθῶ παρών Id. Ph. 124; ἐκ τῶν φαινομένων κατωπτευμένων Phld. Sign. 25.

children.label: II
children.definition: exert a baleful aspect, Petos. ap. Vett.Val. 112.37.
spy, scout, A. Th. 36 (pl.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Hp. Fist. 3, Haem. 5 ( κάτοπτρον Erot.).
Str. 9.3.15; κατοπτήριον, τό, height which commands a view, Delph. 3(2).136.
h.Merc. 372, Hdt. 3.17, 21, etc.
one who visits or explores, κλιμάτων καὶ ἐθνῶν Vett.Val. 330.15; one who contemplates, οὐρανοῦ Ph. Bybl. ap. Eus. PE 1.10.

children.label: II
children.definition: overseer, κατόπτης δʼ εἴμʼ ἐγὼ τῶν πραγμάτων A. Th. 41; ὦ Ζεῦ διόπτα καὶ κατόπτα Ar. Ach. 435.

data.quote: κατόπτης δʼ εἴμʼ ἐγὼ τῶν πραγμάτων

children.definition: κατόπτας, ὁ, title of an officer in Boeot. towns, IG 7.303.21 ( Oropus), 3172.140 ( Orchomenus).
roasting or baking, Phld. D. 1.19, Gal. 11.694.
concerning the κατόπτης II 2, IG 7.3073.88 (Lebad.).
Stob. 4.21.16; Dor. word, cf. ὀπτίλος.
visible, ὥστε μὴ κάτοπτα εἶναι Th. 8.104; χωρίον ἄερκτον καὶ πανταχόθεν κ. Lys. 7.28.

children.label: II
children.definition: looking down over, πορθμοῦ κάτοπτον πρῶνα (Canter for κάτοπτρον) A. Ag. 307.
dried-up, of a kind of myrrh, Dsc. 1.64; ἡ ἐκ τῶν καμίνων κ. γῆ Id. 5.158; over-baked, ἄρτοι Ath.Med. ap. Orib. 1.9.2, cf. Gloss.

data.quote: ἡ ἐκ τῶν καμίνων κ. γῆ

children.definition: show as in a mirror or by reflexion, τοῦ-ίζοντος [τὴν ἶριν] ἀστέρος Placit. 3.5.11:— Pass., to be mirrored, Anon. Oxy. 1609.19.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., look into a mirror, behold oneself in it, Zeno Stoic. 1.66, S.E. P. 1.48, Ath. 15.687c, etc.
behold as in a mirror, ἰδέαν Ph. 1.107; δόξαν Κυρίου 2 Ep.Cor. 3.18 (but here perh. reflect).

of or in a mirror, φαντασία Placit. 3.1.2; ἐμφάσεις ib. 3.2.1; τὰ κ. reflected images, ib. 3.5.6; but, Theory of Reflexion, title of work by Hero, Damian. Opt. 14:—also κατοπτρική, ἡ, Procl. in Euc. p.40 F.; κατοπτρικόν, τό, Hero *Deff. 135.12. Adv. - κῶς by reflexion, βλέπεσθαι Placit. 2.24.1.
reflecting stone found in Cappadocia, Plin. HN 37.152.
like a mirror, prob. l. in Placit. 2.25.14, cf. Alex.Aphr. in Mete. 144.6.

mirror, κ. εἴδους χαλκός A. Fr. 393, cf. E. Hipp. 429, etc.; τίς γὰρ κατόπτρῳ καὶ τυφλῷ κοινωνία; Com. ap. Stob. 4.30.6a; κ. ἀνδρομήκη Phld. Rh. 2.206S.; ἐν κατόπτρῳ . . κατιδεῖν εἴδωλα παρέχοντι Pl. Ti. 71b; ὥσπερ ἐν κ. ἑαυτὸν ὁρῶν Id. Phdr. 255d, etc.; = μηλωτίς, Hp. ap. Erot. (v. κατοπτήρ II): metaph., εὖ γὰρ ἐξεπίσταμαι ὁμιλίας κ. companionshipʼs true mirror, A. Ag. 839; ἡ Ὀδύσσεια καλὸν ἀνθρωπίνου βίου κ. Alcid. ap. Arist. Rh. 1406b13; κ. φύσεος, of a wine-cup, Theopomp.Com. 32.3:—spelt κάτροπτον in Att. Inscrr., IG 2(2).1471.47, 1544.58 (iv B.C.), al., and this form shd. be restored in Pl. Cra. 414c: κάθοπτρον shd. perh. be restored in Annuario 4/5.463.

data.quote: ἡ Ὀδύσσεια καλὸν ἀνθρωπίνου βίου κ.

children.definition: sound with music through, τῆς ἐρημίας AP 9.264 ( Apollonid. or Phil.).

definition: κατοργάω, strengthd. for ὀργάω, Hsch., Phot.

children.definition: initiate in orgies, prepare for them, Plu. Sol. 12:— Pass., Id. Amat. 2.766b, Fr. 6.2, Luc. Trag. 125.
pf. Med. κατωργώμεθα we have quarrelled with each other, PMagd. 10.3 (iii B.C.).

definition: κατορέγομαι, Med., strengthd. for ὀρέγομαι, Simp. in Epict. p.6 D.

children.definition: straight, Mnesith. ap. Orib. 8.38.4.
set upright, erect, δέμας E. Hipp. 1445, Andr. 1080; set straight a fractured or dislocated bone, Hp. Fract. 16, al. ( Med., have it set straight, 8, al.); κ. τὰ κηρία, of bees, Arist. HA 625b19.
keep straight, set right, πολλά τοι σμικροὶ λόγοι . . κατώρθωσαν βροτούς S. El. 416; κατορθοῦντος φρένα Id. OC 1487; κ. τοὺς ἀγωνιζομένους make them prosper, D. 18.290.

data.quote: πολλά τοι σμικροὶ λόγοι . . κατώρθωσαν βροτούς

children.label: b
children.definition: accomplish successfully, bring to a successful issue, τὸν ἀγῶνα Lys. 18.13; πολλὰ καὶ μεγάλα Pl. Men. 99c; εἰ γὰρ ἓν ὧν ἐπεβούλευσεν κατώρθωσεν D. 21.106; ὁδόν Id. 24.7; μηδὲν ἁμαρτεῖν ἐστὶ θεῶν καὶ πάντα κ. Epigr.ib. 18.289; τουτὶ κατωρθώκαμεν περὶ ἐπιστήμης Pl. Tht. 203b, cf. E. Hel. 1067; τὰς ἐπιβολάς Plb. 10.2.5, etc.:— Pass., succeed, prosper, Hdt. 1.120, E. Hipp. 680, Arist. EN 1106b26; ἐπειδὴ δρᾶν κατώρθωσαι φρενί thou hast rightly purposed, A. Ch. 512; κατωρθωμένος, of works of art, successful, Str. 9.1.17, al.; τὰ μάλισθʼ ὑπὸ τῶν τεχνικωτάτων -ούμενα Phld. Vit. p.33 J.; ὅσα κατώρθωται αὐτῶν the most perfect examples, Plot. 5.8.2: Gramm., βαρυνόμενον τὸ ἔστε κατώρθωται is correctly accented, A.D. Synt. 263.14.

data.quote: εἰ γὰρ ἓν ὧν ἐπεβούλευσεν κατώρθωσεν

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., go on prosperously, succeed, opp. πταίειν, Th. 6.12, cf. D. 11.11, Men. Epit. 339; opp. ἡττᾶσθαι, ἔν τινι Isoc. 4.124; opp. ἀτυχεῖν, ib. 48; opp. ἁμαρτάνειν, Arist. EN 1106b31, Chrysipp.Stoic. 2.295; κ. τῷ σώματι Pl. Lg. 654c; of success in war, X. Mem. 3.1.3; τῇ μάχῃ, τοῖς ὅλοις, Plb. 2.70.6, 3.48.2; περί τινας τῶν πράξεων Isoc. 7.11; τὸ κατορθοῦν success, D. 2.20.

children.label: III
children.definition: Med. in sense of Act. I.2 b, τῇ πόλει κατορθωσάμενος ἀγαθά IPE 12.34.28 ( Olbia, i B.C.).

success, opp. εὐτύχημα, Arist. MM 1199a13, cf. Plb. 1.19.12, Str. 15.1.54, D.S. 13.22, Plu. Mar. 10; of literary style, Longin. 33.1, 36.2: pl., opp. ἀποτεύγματα, Phld. Vit. p.35 J.; v.l. for διορθ-, Act.Ap. 24.2 (pl.).
that which is done rightly, virtuous action, in pl., opp. ἁμαρτήματα, Chrysipp.Stoic. 2.295, al., cf. IG 5(2).268.15 ( Mantinea, i B.C.), etc.; τῶν καθηκόντων τὰ τέλεια, = τὰ κ., Stoic. 3.134.
perfection, τέλος καὶ πέρας καὶ κ. Herm. in Phdr. p.173 A., cf. S.E. M. 9.16.
correct use, opp. βαρβαρισμός, Ph. 1.124.
setting straight, of a fractured bone, Hp. Fract. 26 (pl.), Art. 71.
setting up, τοῦ θρόνου LXX Ps. 96(97).2.

children.label: II
children.definition: successful accomplishment of a thing, success, Arist. Rh. 1380b4, Plb. 9.19.4: in pl., successes, Id. 39.7.7.
setting right, reform, amendment, τῆς πολιτείας Id. 3.30.2; τῶν πραγμάτων Id. 2.53.3.
right action, = foreg. 2, Chrysipp.Stoic. 3.21 (pl.), al.
one must correctly estimate, Ptol. Tetr. 193.
one must set dislocated limbs, Paul.Aeg. 6.120.
one who successfully accomplishes, πραγμάτων, ἔργων, Vett.Val. 48.3, (Max.Tyr. 21.6.
τριῶν ἀνδρῶν δημοσίων πραγμάτων κ., trans. of Lat. triumvir reipublicae constituendae, Mon.Anc.Gr. 4.2.
likely or able to succeed, opp. ἁμαρτητικός, Arist. EN 1104b33; successful, ἐν ταῖς μάχαις Plu. Phil. 8; μεγάλων [πραγμάτων] Vett.Val. 15.10; virtuous, ἔρως Herm. in Phdr. p.170 A.
rush downwards, h.Cer. 341.

definition: κάτορρα ἡ καταρόα, βωμὸς ἐνόδιος ( βώμενος ἐνόδειος cod.), Hsch.

children.definition: fear, dread, c. acc., Plb. 14.1.5, Luc. Dem.Enc. 3: abs., to be afraid, μή . . Plb. 10.3.5, cf. Onos. 11.3.
deep-buried, Suid.
burying deep, Thphr. HP 5.7.7.

definition: κατορύσσω, Att. κατορύττω, fut. Pass. - ορυχθήσομαι cj. in Antipho 3.2.10, - ορῠχήσομαι cj. in Ar. Av. 394 (lyr.): pf. Pass. - ορώρυγμαι Antipho 3.3.12, etc., later κατώρυγμαι LW 1075 (Apollonia ad Rhyndacum), Str. 9.3.8, cf. Moer. p.240 P.: aor. 2 inf. Pass. -ορῠγῆναι Arr. Epict. 4.8.36:—

children.definition: bury, sink in the earth, Hdt. 2.41, Hp. Fract. 13; ζώοντας ἐπὶ κεφαλὴν κατώρυξε Hdt. 3.35, cf. 7.114; ἐν τῇ κεφαλῇ Ar. Av. 475; πατέρα ζῶντα κ. X. Mem. 1.2.55; κ. κατὰ γῆς Hdt. 8.36; κατὰ τῆς γῆς Ar. Pl. 238; τινὰ εἰς πηλόν (of poets’ descriptions) Pl. R. 363d; [ τὰ ᾠὰ] εἰς τὴν κόπρον Arist. HA 559b2:— Pass., ζῶντες κατορωρύγμεθα Antipho 3.3.12, cf. X. An. 5.8.11, Com.Adesp. 1224; τὰ -ορυττόμενα κατὰ γῆς Thphr. HP 5.7.6, cf. Archestr. Fr. 62.21; of metals, lie buried, Pl. Euthd. 288e; of money, to be buried, D. 27.53 (metaph., 29.49); ἐν πορφυρίσι -ορωρυγμένος, of Sardanapallus, (Max.Tyr. 35.1.
ruin utterly, Pherecr. 145.19.

children.label: b
children.definition: suppress, κ. τῷ λόγῳ Lib. Or. 42.14:— Pass., πρᾶγμα καταπεφρονημένον καὶ κατορωρυγμένον ib. 62.32.
buried treasure, Hsch. (pl.).
darken, Hsch.
dance in triumph over one, treat despitefully, Hdt. 3.151, LXX Za. 12.10, Phld. Piet. 52, Ael. NA 5.54; τῆς ἀναισθησίας Plu. Adul. 2.57a.

children.label: II
children.definition: subdue or enchant by dancing, Luc. Salt. 22.

children.label: III
children.definition: dance vehemently, Str. 17.1.17.
contemplate, behold, AP 12.91 ( Polystr.).
smell, c. gen., Suid.

definition: κατότι, Adv., Ion. for καθότι or καθʼ ὅ τι.

children.definition: under the ground, οἱ κ. Hes. Fr. 60; κ. βόθρος h.Merc. 112; κ. γίγας, of Briareus, Call. Del. 142; κ. φόβοι Juba Hist. 9.
shrouding, νύξ S. Fr. 433; but taken as = ὀλοή, A.R. 4.1695. (From κατειλέω, cf. Hsch. s.v. κατειλάδα.)

definition: κατουλέω, and κατούλη, ἡ, dub. sens. in IG 5(2).357.6 ( Stymphalus).

children.definition: cicatrized, Gloss.
cause to cicatrize, D.S. 32.10, Dsc. 5.74:— Pass., cicatrize, heal over, AP 9.311 ( Phil.), Thessal. ap. Gal. 10.250.
cicatrization, Dsc. Eup. 1.51, Heliod. ap. Orib. 44.8.12.
causing cicatrization, Heras ap. Gal. 13.432.
make water upon, τινος Ar. Ec. 832: abs., make water, Arist. HA 556b15, Luc. Merc.Cond. 34.

bring into port with a fair wind, metaph., bring safe to port, bring to fulfilment, τάδʼ ὀρθῶς ἔμπεδα κατουρίζει (sc. the oracle), or (as others) intr., these things come to fulfilment, S. Tr. 827 (lyr.).
sail with a fair wind, Plb. 1.44.3, 1.61.7:—also in Med., Luc. Lex. 15.
Tab.Defix.Aud. 72.13.
to be furnished with eyebrows, in pf. part., Philostr. VA 3.8: metaph., λόγοι κατωφρυωμένοι stern, severe words, Luc. Am. 53.
holder, support in machinery, Hero Bel. 78.2; κ. πυλάων bolt, Call. Ap. 6; tenon, Sm. Ex. 26.17.
have a female animal covered, LXX Le. 19.19, cf. Hsch.

children.label: II
children.definition: pf. part. Pass. κατωχευμένος fertilized, φοίνικες Mitteis Chr. 151.26 (iii A.D.).

holding fast, detention, τινὸς ἐν Σούσοισι Hdt. 5.35; of detention by the god in the Sarapeum, UPZ 5.3, 59.8, al. (ii B.C.), cf. Man. 1.239 (pl.); arrest, PAmh. 2.80.9 (iii A.D.), Cod.Just. 1.4.22.1; ἡ πρὸς τὸ χρέος κ. PSI 4.282.28 (ii A.D.).
hindrance, delay, ἀνείρξεις καὶ κ. Plu. Gen.Socr. 2.584e, cf. Vett.Val. 43.17.
retention, τοῦ πνεύματος holding the breath, Gal. 6.161, Alex.Aphr. Pr. 1.47; retention of waste products, Gal. 8.440.
retention in memory, Corn. ND 14; μνήμη καὶ κ. Plot. 4.3.29: pl., τὰς μνήμας κ. μαθημάτων καὶ αἰσθήσεων εἶναι Id. 4.6.1.

data.quote: τὰς μνήμας κ. μαθημάτων καὶ αἰσθήσεων εἶναι

children.definition: sequestration of property, ἐν κ. PTeb. 143 (ii B.C.), cf. PRyl. 174.23 (ii A.D.), etc.; lien, charge, καθαρὸς ἀπὸ πάσης κ. POxy. 483.26 (ii A.D.), etc.

possession by a spirit, inspiration, κ. καὶ ἐνθουσιασμοί Plu. Alex. 2; πάντα ἐν τῇ κ. ἀληθεύειν Arr. An. 4.13.5.
catalepsy, Gal. 9.189, 10.932; κ. τῶν ἄρθρων stiffness, Asclep. ap. eund. 13.967.

definition: κατόχιμος, later form for κατοκώχιμος (q. v.),

children.definition: held in possession, εἰς αἰῶνα LXX Le. 25.46; sequestered, κλῆρος PFrankf. 7 B 9 (iii B.C.), cf. PTeb. 61 ( b). 253 (ii B.C.).
possessed by a supernatural power, Hsch. s.v. κατοκώχιμον, Gloss.; of things, ‘ eerie’, uncanny, κ. πάντα καὶ φρικώδη καὶ μυστικά Luc. JTr. 30.

children.definition: with adhesive properties, Plin. HN 37.152.

holding fast, μοχλοί LXX Jn. 2.7; δεσμοί Plu. Fort.Rom. 2.321d; φάρμακα κ. τῶν ἐμβρύων drugs which prevent miscarriage, Aët. 16.21; retentive, of memory, Plu. Cat.Mi. 1; secure, κτῆσις κ. καὶ βέβαιος D.H. Isoc. 9.
possessing, inspiring, Μοῦσα Asp. ap. Ath. 5.219d; in magic, inhibiting, Ἑρμῆς Tab.Defix. 89.2 (iv B.C.), al.

possessed, inspired, δαίμονί τινι Arist. Mir. 846b24; τῷ Σαβαζίῳ Iamb. Myst. 3.9; ἐκ θεοῦ Plu. Rom. 19, etc.; ἐκ τοῦ θείου Arr. An. 4.13.5; ἐκ Μουσῶν Luc. Hist.Conscr. 8; ἐξ Ἄρεως Polyaen. 1.20; ἐκ πυξίου Luc. Ind. 15; στροφὴν ὁλοσώματον ὥσπερ οἱ κ. δινεύοντες Hld. 4.17, cf. 8.11, 10.9; also perh. of cloistered worshippers, recluses, οἱ κ. οὐρανίου Διός OGI 262.25 ( Baetocaece, iii A.D.), cf. CIG 4475 (ibid., iii A.D.): abs., Cleanth.Stoic. 1.123; ἐν ἱεροῖς κ. Vett.Val. 73.24.

data.quote: στροφὴν ὁλοσώματον ὥσπερ οἱ κ. δινεύοντες

inhibitory spell, PMag.Par. 1.1052, 2.162, Tab.Defix.Aud. 187.55.

visible, A.R. 2.543.

sight, Epicur. Nat. 11.4, 7.
spend or waste in eating, Aeschin. 1.95 ( Pass.), Lib. Decl. 33.31 ( Act.).

monal pheasant, Clitarch. 20, 21 J., Nonn. D. 26.212.

καττίτερος, καττιτέρινος, κάττῡμα, Att. for κασσίτερος, κάσσυμα.

piece of leather, Ar. Fr. 285 (v. κασσύω).

κατυβρίζω, κατύπερθε, κατυπέρτερος, κατυπνόω, Ion. for καθ-.

children.label: I
children.definition: downwards, ἐπισκύνιον κ. ἕλκεται Il. 17.136; κ. ὁρόων Od. 23.91; κατὰ τείχεος κ. ῥίπτειν Hdt. 8.53; κατώρυξέν με κατὰ τῆς γῆς κ. Ar. Pl. 238; χώρει κ. A. Pr. 74; κ. δάκρυʼ εἰβομένη S. Ant. 527 (anap.), cf. E. Fr. 384; esp. of the nether world, A. Pers. 839, S. Ant. 197, etc.; κ. βλέπειν, φέρεσθαι, Pl. R. 500b, 584e; κ. διεχώρει αὐτοῖς they suffered from diarrhoea, X. An. 4.8.20, cf. Hp. Epid. 5.20; φάρμακον πῖσαι κ. give a purgative, Id. Aff. 32, cf. 15; κ. βοηθεῖν go down to help, D. 32.5; for ἄνω καὶ κάτω, ἄνω κάτω, etc., v. ἄνω (B) A. II.2.

data.quote: κατώρυξέν με κατὰ τῆς γῆς κ.

children.definition: downwards, in a chain of causes, ἐπὶ τὸ κ. ἰέναι Arist. Metaph. 994a19.
down from, πετρῶν ὦσαι κ. E. Cyc. 448.

children.label: II
children.definition: beneath, below, opp. ἄνω, Hes. Th. 301, etc.: ὁ τόπος ὁ κ. καλούμενος Pl. Phd. 112c.

children.label: b

children.label: c
children.definition: below, southward, Hdt., v. ἄνω (B) A. II.1e; also κ. οἰκεῖν to dwell on the coast, Th. 1.7; οἱ κ., opp. οἱ τὴν μεσόγειαν κατῳκημένοι, ib. 120; ἡ. κ. Γαλατία lower Galatia, Plu. Aem. 9, etc.; βασιλεὺς τῶν τε ἄνω καὶ τῶν κ. χωρῶν OGI 90.3 ( Rosetta, ii B.C.).

data.quote: βασιλεὺς τῶν τε ἄνω καὶ τῶν κ. χωρῶν

children.label: d
children.definition: τὰ κ. the starting-place, opp. τὰ ἄνω (the goal), Pl. R. 613b.

children.label: f

children.label: g
children.definition: τὰ κ. the lower members in a descending series of genera and species, Arist. APo. 97a31, Metaph. 992a18.

children.label: III

definition: κατωβλέπων or κατώ-βλεπον, οντος, ὁ or τό,

Alex.Trall. Febr. 4: κατώγειος τόπος Gp. 9.22.2: κατώγεως, Suid.
in great pain or affliction, LXX 1 Ki. 1.10, al.

data.quote: ἐκ τῆς γῆς κάτωθεν ἀνίεται ὁ πλοῦτος

children.definition: below, beneath, τὰ κ. Pl. Cra. 408d; τὰ κ. ἰσχυρότατʼ εἶναι δεῖ D. 2.10; ὁ κ. νόμος the law below, Id. 23.28, cf. Did. ap. Harp. s.v. ὁ κ. νόμος; τίς οἶδεν εἰ κ. εὐαγῆ τάδε; S. Ant. 521; οἱ κ. θεοί ib. 1070, cf. E. Alc. 424.
τοὺς εἰς τὸ κ. those belonging to the next generation, Pl. Ti. 18d.
Arist. APo. 96b37, Top. 144a29.

sworn in affirmation, ὅρκος Harp. s.v. ἐπακτός.

bird, Hsch.; cf. καυκιάλης.

cup, AP 9.749 ( in lemmate), Just. Nov. 105.2.1; κ. ἀργύρεον PMasp. 167.10 (vi A.D.).

Hermipp. 63.4; κ. ἐκ Καρχηδόνος Eub. 19; κ. Λίβυς Antiph. 217.13, cf. 325; κράμβης BGU 1118.12 (pl., i B.C.), cf. Dsc. 2.120, Archig. ap. Gal. 13.331.

Ti. 70d; ἐὰν ᾖ κ. Arist. Mete. 342b10: freq. in pl., ἡλίου τε καύμασιν S. OC 350, cf. Hdt. 3.104, X. Cyn. 5.9, etc.; [ τόποι] ὑπὸ καυμάτων διαφθειρόμενοι Isoc. 11.12; καύματα καὶ χειμῶνες Phld. Piet. 87: in pl., also of frost, Ath. 3.98b, Luc. Lex. 2.
fever heat, Th. 2.49; of inflamed conditions, Hp. VM 19, Aph. 7.13: metaph., of love, κ. ἀρσενικόν AP 12.87.

children.label: II
children.definition: holes burnt by cautery, Hp. Art. 11, Arist. Pr. 863a31.

children.label: III
children.definition: brand on cattle, IG 7.3171.44 (Orchom. Boeot.).

children.label: IV
children.definition: embers of sacrifices, Pl. Criti. 120d.

children.label: V
children.definition: firewood, PLond. 3.1166.6, al. (i A.D.).
very hot, Str. 16.4.1.
burning hot, of the sun, Thphr. Sign. 11, 26, al.
burn, scorch up, Apoc. 16.8:— Pass., to be burnt up, Ev.Matt. 13.6; become heated, suffer from heat, Plu. Virt. et vit. 2.100b, QConv. 691f, Arr. Epict. 1.6.26, Sor. 1.108, M.Ant. 7.64.
burning, scorching, θέρος οὐ λίην κ. Hp. Epid. 1.4; νότος Arist. Mete. 364b23; ὁδός D.S. 19.18; ὥρα Longus 1.30.
feverish, ῥίγεα Hp. Prorrh. 1.67, al.: metaph., ἡδονή Ach.Tat. 2.37.
fever, perh. to be read in Call. Aet. 3.1.19 [Fr. 75.19 Pf.].

thick cloak, Ar. V. 1137; κ. πορφυροῦς Men. 972; said to be of Persian or Babylonian make, Arr. An. 6.29.5, Poll. 7.59, cf. Sch. Ar. l.c., Semus 20, PCair.Zen. 48.3 (iii B.C.), PHib. 1.121.11 (iii B.C.):—also καυνάκη, ἡ, PSI 6.605 (iii B.C.); cf. γαυνάκη (which is also found in codd. of Peripl.M.Rubr. 6):— Dim. καυνάκιον, τό, Zonar. (Assyr. gaunakka ‘frilled and flounced mantle’.)
weaver of καυνάκαι, PMasp. 283ii17 (vi A.D.).
plaster, Gal. 13.532.
a wind blowing from Caunus (in Caria) to Rhodes, Arist. Vent. 973a4.

of or from Caunus (in Caria), Hdt. 1.172, etc.; ἡ K. βοῦς, of labour in vain—for this cow overturned the pail after being milked, App.Prov. 3.6; but K. ἔρως, of illicit love, from Caunus, brother and lover of Byblis, Arist. Rh. 1402b3.

definition: καυνός (on the accent, v. Hdn.Gr. 1.178), ὁ,

children.definition: Cratin. 194, Ar. Fr. 660.

definition: καῦρος (on the accent, v. Hdn.Gr. 1.193), α, ον,
καυσαλίς, ίδος, ἡ, prob. glossed by ἡ μέλαινα καὶ ὑπέρυθρος, Hsch. ( καύσαλις cod.); perh. to be read for καυκαλίς, of a kind of σμύρνα, Dsc. 1.64 (and so in Orib. 12 s.v.), and for καυχαλίς (q.v.).

καυσία, ἡ, felt hat used by the Macedonians, forming part of the regalia of their kings, Men. 331, Duris 14 J., Ephipp. ( FGrH 126) 5 J., Nearch. 28 J., Plb. 4.4.5, AP 6.335 ( Antip. Thess.), Plu. Ant. 54, Arr. An. 7.22.2, Hdn. 4.8.2.

children.definition: combustible, ἔκαιον πάντα, ὅσα κ. ἑώρων X. An. 6.3.19; κ. ξύλα Alex. 307, PStrassb. 117.3 (i A.D.); ὕλη Pl. Lg. 849d, Str. 16.4.19; ἄχυρον Ostr.Fay. 21 (iv A.D.); τούτοις καυσίμοις χρῶνται as fuel, Thphr. HP 4.3.2.
burning, [ τῶν ἱρῶν] Hdt. 2.40; λύχνοι τῆς κ. LXX Ex. 39.17 ( 37), cf. PLond. 3.1177.74 (ii A.D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: cautery, Hp. Mochl. 3; ἢ καύσει ἢ τομῇ Pl. R. 406d: in pl., Hp. Art. 11, Pl. R. 426b, Ti. 65b.

children.label: III
children.definition: burning heat, ψύξεις τε καὶ κ. Id. Tht. 156b.

children.label: IV
children.definition: smelting, χαλκοῦ, ἀργύρου, Str. 14.6.5.
cautery, prob. in Gloss. (written casmos).
causing heat, gloss on αἴθων, Eust.ad D.P. 591.

causus, i.e. bilious remittent fever (the endemic fever of the Levant), Hp. VM 17 (pl.), Aph. 3.21 (pl.), Arist. Pr. 861b34, 862a2; πυρέττειν καύσῳ Id. Metaph. 981a12; κ. στομάχου heartburn, Dsc. 1.43, al.: generally, fever, heat, Nic. Th. 338.

children.label: II
children.definition: Ath.Med. ap. Orib. 1.2.4.
Procl. Par.Ptol. 41, 81.
heat, Ptol. Tetr. 18:— Pass., burn with intense heat, 2 Ep.Pet. 3.10, 12: generally, to be burnt, PHolm. 25.27.

children.label: II
children.definition: suffer from καῦσος (A) I, Antyll. ap. Orib. 9.13.1, Gal. 15.720; καυσουμένη ἐπιφάνεια Dsc. 2.134.

burning hot, raging, only as Adj. in gen., μάχης καυστείρης Il. 4.342, 12.316; καυστείρης . . καμίνου Nic. Th. 924: accented καυστειρῆς in good codd. of Hom. and Nic.:—later taken to be from καυστειρός, hence καυστειροῖο Opp. H. 2.509 ( v.l. καυστηρ- both here and in Nic. l.c.), and perhaps so Call. POxy 2375 ii 2. cf. EM 493.44, Hsch.
one must burn, Dsc. 5.79.
cauterizing apparatus, Hp. Haem. 6 (cited as καυτήρ by Gal. 19.111); in form καυτήρ, Hippiatr. 26, Gal. 14.782; on the accent, v. Hdn.Gr. 2.922.
one that burns, τινος Dosiad. Ara 11; νεκρῶν Gloss.; one that smelts, Ptol. Tetr. 179; stoker, BGU 952.5 (ii/iii A.D.).

capable of burning, opp. καυστός ( capable of being burnt), τὸ καυστὸν οὐ καίεται . . ἄνευ τοῦ καυστικοῦ Arist. de An. 417a8, cf. Ph. 251a16; τὸ πῦρ φύσει κ. Phld. Mus. p.71 K.: Comp. - ώτερος Arist. PA 648b18: Sup. - ώτατος Id. Cael. 307a1, Corn. ND 32.

data.quote: τὸ καυστὸν οὐ καίεται . . ἄνευ τοῦ καυστικοῦ

children.label: b
children.definition: corrosive, caustic, δύναμις κ. Dsc. 2.4 ( Comp.); φάρμακα κ. Gal. 11.754, Zopyr. ap. Orib. 14.57.1.
of or by means of burning, βάσανοι LXX 4 Ma. 6.27. Adv. -κῶς, βλάπτειν Eust. 70.36.
feverish, Hp. Prorrh. 1.70; also τὰ κ. inflammatory humours, Id. Epid. 4.2.
Hsch.

definition: καυστός or καυτός (as Inscrr.), ή, όν,

children.definition: burnt, red-hot, καυτὸν μοχλόν E. Cyc. 633 (Scal.for καὶ τὸν): καυστόν, τό, burnt-offering for the dead, Phot.; so καυτόν Hsch.; whole burnt-offering, ἄγοντι τὸμ βοῦν καὶ τὸγ καυτόν SIG 1025.31 ( Cos); ἀρὴν καυτός ib. 1027.9 (ibid.).

data.quote: ἄγοντι τὸμ βοῦν καὶ τὸγ καυτόν

children.definition: capable of being burnt, opp. ἄκαυστος, Arist. Mete. 387a17, al.; cf. καυστικός: Comp. - ότερος Thphr. Ign. 72.
place where corpses were burnt, Str. 5.3.8, CIG 2942 ( Tralles), Gloss.
of or from the river Cayster (in Lydia), Ar. Ach. 68, etc.
suffering from heat, parched, [ χῶραι] Thphr. CP 3.14.3; τόποι Arch.Pap. 6.101 (ii A.D.).
πυρετοί Hp. Aph. 4.54, Coac. 570; κ. ὕδατα, ταρίχη, heating, Id. Aër. 7, Diph.Siph. ap. Ath. 3.120e; κ. ποιεῖν τὸν στόμαχον Heraclid.Tar. ap. eund. 3.79f. Adv. -δῶς Archig. ap. Gal. 12.543.
causing fevers, Heph.Astr. 1.1.

burning heat, summer heat, Ev.Matt. 20.12, Orph. Fr. 264, Luc. Philops. 25; καύσωνος ὥρᾳ Diph.Siph. ap. Ath. 3.73a; ἄνεμος καύσων sirocco, LXX Je. 18.17, al.; κ. alone, ib. Ju. 8.3, Ep.Jac. 1.11, Ath.Med. ap. Orib. 1.2.13, Ptol. Tetr. 85.
κ. στομάχου heartburn, Dsc. 1.22.
κ. πυρετός, = καῦσος (A) I, Alex.Trall. Febr. 2.

children.label: II
children.definition: Ael. NA 6.51, Philum. Ven. 20.1.
burner, ταύρῳ χαλκέῳ, of Phalaris, Pi. P. 1.95.

children.label: III
children.definition: Luc. Pisc. 46, Jul. Caes. 309c.
brand, Str. 5.1.9:— Pass., Hippiatr. 1: metaph., κεκαυτηριασμένοι τὴν ἰδίαν συνείδησιν 1 Ep.Ti. 4.2.

definition: καυτηρίδιον, τό, Dim. of sq., Gal. 19.111.

children.definition: branding iron, E. Fr. 815 (cj.), LXX 4 Ma. 15.22, Luc. Pisc. 52 (vulg. καυστ-), Apol. 2, Hippiatr. 26: metaph., ὥσπερ καυτήρια ταῖς ψυχαῖς προσάγειν D.S. 20.54.

children.label: II
children.definition: burnt mark, brand, Str. 5.1.9, BGU 469.7 (ii A.D.).

children.label: IV
children.definition: καυστ-) kiln, PLond. 2.391.8 (vi A.D.).
capable of burning, χυμός Thphr. CP 6.1.3.

definition: καυχαλίς φλύκταινα ( φυλακταίνα cod.), Hsch.; cf. καυσαλίς.

καυχάομαι, Dor. καυχέομαι Theoc. 5.77; 2 sg. καυχᾶσαι in late Gr., as Ep.Rom. 2.17, 23, etc.: fut. - ήσομαι Hdt. 7.39, Eup. 134, Epicr. 6: aor. ἐκαυχησάμην Arist. Pol. 1311b4; Aeol. opt. καυχάσαιτο Sapph. Supp. 4.2: pf. κεκαύχημαι 2 Ep.Cor. 7.14:— Act., EM 527.1:—

children.definition: speak loud, be loud-tongued, κ. παρὰ καιρόν Pi. O. 9.38, cf. Eup. l.c., etc.; boast, vaunt oneself, ἐπʼ αἰζηοῖσι κ. μέγα Cratin. 95, cf. Lycurg. Fr. 78; εἴς τι Arist. l.c.; ἔν τινι Ep.Rom. ll.cc.: c.acc. et inf., aor. or pres., boast that . . , Hdt. l.c., Epicr. l.c., etc.: c. part., boast of doing or being, Men. Mon. 616, D.H. 8.30; ὅτι . . Str. 13.1.27: c. acc., boast of, Philem. 141, 2 Ep.Cor. 9.2: c.gen., ὧν Ἱππίας ἐκαυχᾶτο Phld. Vit. p.35 J.: c. dat., κάλλει AP 12.234 ( Strat.).

definition: καύχη, ἡ, = sq., ἐπέων καύχας, of heroic verse, Pi. N. 9.7 (nisi leg. καυχᾶσσʼ, i.e. καυχάεσσα, Dor. fem. of καυχήεις).

children.definition: a boast, vaunt, Pi. I. 5(4).51.
subject of boasting, Lesb.Rh. 3.4 (pl.), Ep.Rom. 4.2.
boaster, braggart, Ptol. Tetr. 159, EM 121.7; boastful, λόγος Sch. Il. 13.373.
boastful, Sch. Il. 8.535 ( Comp.).
boastful, Babr. 5.10, Heph.Astr. 1.10.
boasting, Epicur. Fr. 93, LXX 1 Ch. 29.13, al., Phld. Vit. p.27 J., Ph. 1.534, Ep.Rom. 15.17.
boaster, Sch. Il. 7.96:—written καυχ-ηστής, EM 121.6.
boast aloud, EM 206.22, Sch. Ar. Pl. 572.
κάφα· λουτήρ ( Lacon.), Hsch. ( Lacon. form of σκάφη). καφάζειν· γελᾶν, Id. καφάν, Dor. for κηφήν, Id. καφίδιος, v. κηφ-. κάφος, = κάπος, EM 499.38.
camphor, Arabic kāfūr, Cinnamomum Camphora, interpol. in Gal. 14.761, Aët. 12.63, 16.130.

definition: κάφρυκτοι ( καρφ- cod.) · φρύγιοι (Rhod.), Hsch. (For κατάφρ-).

children.definition: she fox, Anon. ap. Suid.; cf. σκαφώρη.

definition: καχάζω, Dor. fut. καχαξῶ Theoc. 5.142:—also in nasalized form καγχάζω, S. Aj. 198 (lyr., v.l.), Babr. 99.8, AP 5.229 ( Paul.Sil.), 6.74 ( Agath.); cf. ἀνακαγχάζω:—

children.definition: laugh aloud, S. Ichn. 348, Ar. Ec. 849, Anacreont. 31.29, Luc. DMeretr. 6.3; ἐπί τινι at one, Eub. 8, Luc. Am. 23; μέγα κατά τινος Theoc. l.c.; jeer, mock, ἁπάντων καγχαζόντων γλώσσαις S. Aj. l.c. (Prob. onomatopoeic, by dissim. fr. χὰ χά ‘ ha! ha!ʼ)
loud laughter, v.l. for κιχλισμός, Ar. Nu. 1073 (pl.).
E. Hec. 240.

definition: καχείτης, ου, ὁ, dub. sens. in JHS 32.161 ( Pisidia).

children.definition: to be in a miserable plight, BGU 1141.31 (i B.C.).
to be in a bad habit of body, be unwell, Plb. 29.17.4, Alex.Aphr. in SE 9.1; κ. ταῖς ψυχαῖς to be ill-disposed, disaffected, Plb. 20.7.4; of the condition of a State, ib. 4.1.
in a bad habit of body, Dsc. 2.2, Gal. 6.213, 12.321.
disaffected in a political sense, Plb. 1.68.10, 28.17.12, Cic. Att. 1.14.6, Nech. in Cat.Cod.Astr. 7.142.

definition: καχεξής, ές, = foreg., opp. ἀγαθός, dub. in Phld. Rh. 1.36 S.

children.definition: bad habit of body, opp. εὐεξία, Hp. Aph. 3.31 (pl.), Pl. Grg. 450a, Arist. EN 1129a20, PSI 6.632.8 (iii B.C.); distd. from κακοχυμία, Gal. 10.263.
bad disposition, disaffection, Diph. 24, Nicol.Com. 1.12, Plb. 5.87.3, Hierocl. in CA 7p.430M.: play on both meanings in Str. 14.5.14.
bad style, κ. τῆς ἑρμηνείας Phld. Rh. 1.188 S., al.: pl., ib. 189 S.
ill company, Thgn. 1169.
passing an unhappy day, AP 9.508 ( Pall.); v.l. κακ-.

definition: καχλάζω, also κοχλάζω (q.v.), usu. pres. and impf.,

children.definition: plash or bubble, of the sound of liquids, φιάλαν ἀμπέλου καχλάζοισαν δρόσῳ Pi. O. 7.2, cf. Philostr. VA 3.25; of the sea, περὶ πρύμναν A. Th. 761 (lyr.), cf. 115 (lyr.); ἅσυχα καχλάζοντος αἰγιαλοῖο Theoc. 6.12 (imitated by D.P. 838), cf. Arr. An. 5.20.8; of rain, Lyc. 80; of boiling water, Zos. Alch. p.109 B. (cf. κοχλ-): c. acc. cogn., [ κῦμα] πέριξ ἀφρὸν πολὺν καχλάζον frothing forth foam, E. Hipp. 1211: metaph., of exuberant eloquence, τὸ Πλατωνικὸν νᾶμα . . μεγάλας παρασκευὰς καχλάζον D.H. Dem. 28:—also καχλαίνω, Hsch. [ κᾰ- Pi., A., E. ll.cc., κᾱ- by position, Theoc. l.c.]

data.quote: τὸ Πλατωνικὸν νᾶμα . . μεγάλας παρασκευὰς καχλάζον

definition: καχλασμός, ὁ, = foreg., Zos.Alch. p.119B. (pl.), Gloss.

children.definition: pebble in the beds of rivers, etc., Str. 4.1.7 (pl.), Gal. 12.292, Sch. Theoc. 6.12 (pl.); = caementum, Gloss.: collectively, gravel, shingle, Th. 4.26, J. AJ 5.1.3: also κόχλαξ, = glarea, Gloss. (Onomatopoeic word, cf. καχλάζω.)
keeping bad company, Phld. Ir. p.53 W.
unlucky harbourage, AP 7.640 ( Antip.).
husks of κάχρυς, Arist. Pr. 923b11: sg., prob. in Thphr. CP 5.6.3.
sprout in winter, ὁ σπόρος -άσεται Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(4).251.
made of κάχρυς, ἄρτος Poll. 6.33, 72.

children.definition: κ. πυρός wheat that resembles κάχρυς, Thphr. HP 8.4.3, CP 3.21.2, Orib. inc. 13.7. (The words of this group are freq. written καγχρ-.)
bearing κάχρυ, ῥίζα, = λιβανωτίς, Nic. Th. 40.
bearing winter-buds, Thphr. HP 3.5.6.

definition: κάχρυς, ῠος (acc. κάχρυδα Dieuch. ap. Orib. 4.7.7, gen. υδος ib. 20), ἡ,

children.definition: parched barley, Cratin. 274, Hp. Mul. 1.97, Ar. Nu. 1358, V. 1306, Gal. 11.404.
winter-bud, Thphr. HP 3.5.5, 5.1.4: acc.pl., τὰς κάχρυς ib. 3.14.1.

children.definition: κάχρυ, τό, fruit of λιβανωτίς, ib. 9.11.10, Ph. Bel. 86.23, Dsc. 3.74 (v.l. κάγχρυς); also, the whole plant, Ps.-Dsc. l.c.; κάχρυος ῥίζα Hp. Nat.Mul. 32, Philum. Ven. 6.1.
bearing κάχρυ, Nic. Th. 850.

definition: καχρύω, fut. - ύσω· συγχεῶ, ταράξω, Hsch.

children.definition: like a winter-bud, Thphr. HP 3.12.8 and 17.3.

definition: καχυπονόητος, ον, = sq., cited in error by Poll. 2.57 from Pl. Phdr. 240e; v. καχυπότοπος.

children.definition: suspecting evil, suspicious, Ar. Fr. 794, Pl. R. 409c, Arist. Rh. 1389b21.

definition: κάψα, καψάκης, καψάκιον, v. κάμψα, etc.

children.definition: = Lat. capsarius, IG 3.1171.
napkin or shirt, Com.Adesp. 325 (- όκιον male Hsch.).
like a box, κάρνον PFlor. 241.7 (iii A.D.).
Hsch.: καπηδάλους is corrupt in Eratosth. ap. EM 286.36; cf. ἐγκαψικίδαλος.
gulping, κάψει πίνειν, of the bear, opp. σπάσει and λάψει, Arist. HA 595a10.

definition: κε, also κεν, Ep., Lesb., Cypr. ( Inscr.Cypr. 135.10 H., al.), Thess. ( IG 9(2).517.13, al. ( Larissa)); always enclitic,

children.definition: κᾱ (qq.v.); οὐκ ἄν . . ἀλλά κεν Il. 13.290; οὐκ ἄν . . οὐδέ κε 19.272, al.; both coupled, ἄν κεν 11.187, Od. 5.361, Parm. 8.19, etc.; [ ὄσσα] κε θέλῃ Sapph. Supp. 1.3; τί κεν ποείην; Ead. Oxy. 1787 Fr. 1 + 2.16; κεν ἄν dub. in IGRom. 4.1302.51 ( Cyme); εἴ κʼ ἄν (more prob. εἰκ ἄν) IG 5(2).6 ( Tegea, iv B.C.); κε repeated, Od. 4.733.

definition: κεάζω, Ep. fut. κεάσσω Orph. A. 849: aor. κέᾰσα, κέασσα, ἐκέασσα Hom. (v. infr.):— Pass., aor. κεάσθην Il. 16.412, but part. κεᾰθείσης App.Anth. 3.167: pf. part. κεκεασμένος (v. infr.):—

children.definition: split, cleave wood, κέασε ξύλα νηλέϊ χαλκῷ Od. 14.418; κέασαν ξύλα 20.161; ξύλα . . νέον κεκεασμένα χαλκῷ 18.309, cf. Hp. Mul. 2.153, Call. Fr. 289, etc.; of lightning, shiver, νῆα . . κεραυνῷ Ζεὺς ἔλσας ἐκέασσε Od. 5.132; of a spear, κέασσε δʼ ἄρʼ ὀστέα λευκά Il. 16.347; [ κεφαλὴ] ἄνδιχα πᾶσα κεάσθη was cloven in twain, ib. 412; κεκεασμένον εὐρέϊ κύκλῳ οὐρανόν Arat. 474.
pound, rub to pieces, ἢ σφέλᾳ ἢ ὅλμῳ κεάσας Nic. Th. 644. ( κεᾰ-ζω fr. κεᾰ- in κεᾰ-θείσης (v. supr.), εὐ-κέα-τος, κέαρνον, and perh. κείων, v. κείω (B); perh. cf. Skt. śásati ‘cut’, Lat. castrare.)
corn-thistle, Carduus arvensis, dub.l. in Thphr. HP 4.10.6.
carpenterʼs axe, Hsch. (pl.). κέαρος· ὄρτυξ, Id. κεάσματα, τά, chips, Id. κέᾰται, κέᾰτο, Ep. 3 pl. pres. and impf. of κεῖμαι.

definition: κεβλή (on the accent, v. Hdn.Gr. 1.318), ἡ, Maced. form of κεφαλή, Call. Fr. 140, cf. EM 498.41: κεβαλή, ib. 195.39, Hsch.

made of millet, κ. ἄλευρον Dsc. 5.3, cf. Gal. 6.519; ἡ κεγχρίνη millet-pottage, Hsch.

children.definition: κεγχρ-ῖτις, ἡ, ἰσχάς a dried fig (from its number of grains), AP 6.231 ( Phil.).
Ps.-Plu. Fluv. 19.2.
millet-throwers, fabulous tribe in Luc. VH 1.13.
like grains of millet, ἱδρῶτες interpol. in Hp. Prog. 6; κ. τραχύσματα granulated work on silver cups, Ath. 11.475b. Adv. -δῶς Steph. in Hp. 1.114 D.

definition: κέγχρος, ὁ (also ἡ, Arist. Ph. 250a20, Dieuch. ap. Orib. 4.7.15, Glauc. ap. POxy. 1802.42, Dsc. 2.97, Gal. 6.791, Jul. Or. 3.112a, Iamb. VP 24.106),

children.definition: millet, Panicum miliaceum, usu. in pl., Hes. Sc. 398, Hdt. 4.17, Hp. Acut. 21, X. An. 1.2.22, etc.: sg., Hecat. 154 J., Hdt. 1.193, Thphr. HP 1.11.2, al., OGI 55.15 ( Telmessus, iii B.C.); of a single grain, Hdt. 3.100, Plot. 6.3.11, prob. in Sapph. Supp. 1.13:—also κέρχνος, Anaxandr. 41.27, Gal. 18(1).574; cf. κέρχνωμα, κέρχνη.

children.label: II
children.definition: anything in small grains:
spawn of fish, Hdt. 2.93.
small beads, Ath. 12.525e.
speck, sty in the eye, Adam. 1.11, al.

children.label: III
children.definition: Dsc. Ther. 15.

children.label: IV
children.definition: small kind of diamond, Plin. HN 37.57.
bearing millet, Str. 5.1.12.
millet-like, of eruptions, Hp. Liqu. 6, Epid. 2.3.1; of plants, Thphr. HP 8.3.3, 4; σάρξ granulated tissue, Archig. ap. Orib. 46.26.1.
things of the size of millet-grains: hence, eyelet-holes in the rim of a shield, E. Ph. 1386.

definition: κέγχρων, ωνος, ὁ, a local wind on the river Phasis, Hp. Aër. 15.

children.definition: covered with specks, εῒδη ὀφθαλμῶν Adam. 1.11.

children.label: II
children.definition: with granulated, roughened surface, of tables, BGU 781 v 14 (i A.D.).
Ep. for κεδάννυμι ( Act. only διὰ . . κεδαίῃ in tmesi, Nic. Al. 458), in Pass., Arat. 159, 410, A.R. 2.626, Nic. Th. 425; κεδόωνται (from κεδάομαι) A.R. 4.500; κεδᾶται Hsch.

definition: κεδάννυμι, poet. for σκεδάννυμι, late in pres., AP 5.275 ( Agath.); Ep. aor. Act. ἐκέδασσα Hom. (v. infr.), Opp. H. 1.412, 3 pl. κέδασαν Hsch., Pass. ἐκεδάσθην Hom. (v. infr.), κεδάσθη Orph. A. 557; plpf. Pass. κεκέδαστο A.R. 2.1112:—

children.definition: break up, scatter, ἐκέδασσε φάλαγγας Il. 17.285; θεὸς δʼ ἐκέδασσεν Ἀχαιούς Od. 14.242; so [ ποταμὸς] ἐκέδασσε γεφύρας Il. 5.88; νεφέλας ἐκέδασσαν ἄελλαι A.R. 3.1360:— Pass., κεδασθείσης ὑσμίνης when the battle was broken up, i.e. when the combatants were no longer in masses, Il. 15.328, 16.306; ἔμειναν ἀθρόοι, οὐδʼ ἐκέδασθεν ἀνὰ στρατόν 15.657; [ δούρατα] ῥαισθείσης (sc. νηός) κεκέδαστο A.R. 2.1112; κῶμα κεδάσθη was shed, Orph. l.c.

data.quote: ἔμειναν ἀθρόοι, οὐδʼ ἐκέδασθεν ἀνὰ στρατόν

children.definition: Hp. Aër. 22, Loc.Hom. 10, Epid. 6.5.15, 7.122, Morb. 1.3; expld. by Gal. 19.111, Erot., Hsch., as arthritic affections; applied to aneurism of the vena cava by Aret. SA 2.8: sg., Hp. ap. Erot. Fr. 54 (s.v.l.).
like κέδματα, Hp. ap. Erot. s.v. κέδματα (dub.l.).

careful, diligent, trusty, ἄναξ Od. 14.170, etc.; ἀμφίπολος 1.335; πολῖται Pi. P. 4.117; οἰακοστρόφος A. Th. 62, E. Med. 523; στρατόμαντις A. Ag. 122 (lyr.); γυνή E. Alc. 97 (lyr.): generally, noble, Φοίνικος κόρα B. 16.29; παρθένος Pi. P. 9.122.

Pass., cared for, cherished, dear, οἵ οἱ κεδνότατοι (v.l. κήδι στοι) καὶ φίλτατοι ἦσαν Il. 9.586; ὅς μοι κήδιστος . . , κεδνότατός τε Od. 10.225; τοκῆες Il. 17.28, cf. Pi. I. 1.5; μήτηρ Hes. Th. 169, Pi. Pae. 6.12, 105; ἀδελφεοί B. 5.118; [ ἄλοχος] Id. 3.33; λέχος E. Fr. 591.

children.label: II
children.definition: Hom. only in neut.pl., κεδνὰ ἰδυῖα true-hearted, Od. 1.428, 19.346, al.; ἤθεα κ. Hes. Op. 699; πολίων κυβερνάσιες Pi. P. 10.72; κ. χάρις valued, prized, Id. O. 8.80; φροντίς, βουλεύματα, wise, A. Pers. 142 (lyr.), 172 (troch.); ἐφετμαί Id. Supp. 206; of news, good, joyful, Id. Ag. 622, cf. 261; οὔπω τι κ. ἔσχον S. Aj. 663; κεδνὰ πράξειν E. Alc. 605 (lyr.).
trustiness, goodness, IG 3.1370.
PAmh. 2.125.3 (i A.D.), Gal. 12.16, al., Paul.Aeg. 7.3, Alex.Trall. 1.1.

definition: Κεδρεᾶτις, ιδος, ἡ, ( κέδρος) title of Artemis at Orchomenus in Arcadia, Paus. 8.13.2.

children.definition: oil of cedar, extracted from cedar-resin, Aët. 1.196.
Syrian cedar, Juniperus excelsa, Plin. HN 13.53, 24.17.
oil of κεδρελάτη, Hdt. 2.87, D.S. 1.91, Dsc. 1.77, Erot. s.v. κεδρίνῳ; cf. κεδρέα.

definition: κεδρίνεος [ ῐ], α, ον, poet. for sq., Nic. Al. 488.

children.definition: of cedar, θάλαμος Il. 24.192; δόμοι E. Alc. 160; ξύλα IG ΙΙ(2).161 D 92 ( Delos, iii B.C.); ξυλεία Plb. 10.27.10; φατνώματα J. BJ 5.5.2; τῶν ξύλων τὰ κ. Thphr. HP 5.9.8.
made from κεδρελάτη, ἔλαιον Hp. Mul. 1.78, Arist. HA 583a23; οἶνος Dsc. 5.36.
κέδρινον, τό, orange-coloured dye, PHolm. 21.30.
κιτρίον, Phan.Hist. 35; Lat. cedrium, = κεδρία, Vitr. 2.9.13, Plin. HN 16.52; κέδριον, with v.l. κέδρινον, Hp. Nat.Mul. 32.
fruit of κεδρελάτη, Hp. Mul. 2.192, Nat. Mul. 32, Dsc. 1.77; also, juniper-berry, Ar. Th. 486.

children.label: II
children.definition: juniper, Juniperus communis, Thphr. HP 1.9.4, etc.
flavoured with κεδρία, Dsc. 5.37.
Dsc. 1.115, Alex.Praef.

definition: κέδρον, τό ( Att. acc. to Hsch.),

children.definition: juniper-berry, EM 498.42, Hsch.:—also κέδρος, ὁ, Com.Adesp. 34 (ap. Ammon. Diff. p.80 V.).

children.label: II
children.definition: cedar-cone, IPE 12.327.
Hsch. (nisi oxyt.sunt).
made of cedar-wood, σανίδες Supp.Epigr. 1.567.6 ( Karanis, iii B.C.).

cedar-tree, ὀδμὴ κέδρου . . θύου τʼ ἀνὰ νῆσον ὀδώδει δαιομένων Od. 5.60; τὸ ἀπὸ κ. ἄλειφαρ γινόμενον Hdt. 2.87, cf. 4.75; applied to prickly cedar, Juniperus Oxycedrus, Od. l.c., Thphr. HP 3.12.3; Syrian cedar, J. excelsa, ib. 3.2.6, Dsc. 1.77; Phoenician cedar, J. phoenicea, Thphr. HP 9.2.3; Himalayan cedar, J. macropoda, Str. 15.1.29; κ. μικρά juniper, J. communis, Dsc. l.c.

data.quote: ὀδμὴ κέδρου . . θύου τʼ ἀνὰ νῆσον ὀδώδει δαιομένων

children.definition: anything made of cedar-wood: cedar coffin, E. Alc. 365 (pl.), Tr. 1141; cedar box, for a bee-hive, Theoc. 7.81.
cedar-oil, τῇ κ. ἀλείφειν Luc. Ind. 16.
rejoicing in cedar, Man. 4.191.
embalm with κεδρία, Posidon. ap. Str. 4.4.5, D.S. 5.29.
bryony, Dsc. 4.182.
made of or inlaid with cedar-wood, παστάδων τέραμνα E. Or. 1371 (lyr.).
Archil. 170, Herod. 1.26.

definition: κεῖα καθάρματα, Hsch.; cf. κήϊα. κειάμενος, κείαντες, v. καίω. κειανθί· καίοντες, Id. κεῖθεν, κεῖθι, v. ἐκεῖθεν, ἐκεῖθι. κείθιον, v. κηθίς.

children.definition: donkey, Sammelb. 5224.29; cf. κίλλος.

definition: κεῖμαι, κεῖσαι Il. 19.319, etc. ( κατά-κειαι h.Merc. 254, Arc. κεῖοι Tab.Defix. in Philol. 59.201), κεῖται Il. 6.47, Hdt. 1.9, 4.62 (v.l. κέεται), IG 1(2).94.25; pl. κεῖνται A. Supp. 242, Ion. κέᾰται Il. 11.659, al., Hdt. ( προσ-κέανται is f.l. 1.133, cf. προσ-κέαται, v.l. - κέονται, Hp. Fract. 6), κείᾰται Mimn. 11.6 ( κατα- Il. 24.567), κέονται Il. 22.510, Od. 16.232, prob. in Alc. 94, συγ-κέονται Aret. SD 2.4; imper. κεῖσο, κείσθω, Il. 18.178, Hdt. 2.171; subj. 3 sg. κέηται Pl. Sph. 257c, Lycurg. 113, Ep. κεῖται (fr. κέy-ε-ται) Il. 19.32, Od. 2.102, al., δια-κέησθε Isoc. 15.259, κείωνται IG 2(2).1176.21; opt. 3 sg. κέοιτο Hdt. 1.67, Hp. Art. 14 ( κατα-), Is. 6.32, Pl. R. 477a; inf. κεῖσθαι Il. 8.126, Hp. Prog. 3, Hdt. 2.127, al., κέεσθαι v.l. in ib. 2, cf. Hp. Aër. 6, Archim. Aequil. 1 Prooem.; part. κείμενος Il. 7.265, etc.: impf. ἐκείμην Od. 13.284, etc., Ep. κείμην 9.434; Ep. 3 sg. κέσκετο 21.41, ( παρε-) 14.521; Ion. 3 pl. ἐκέατο Hdt. 1.167, Ep. κέατο Il. 13.763, κείατο 11.162; κεῖντο 21.426, ( ἐπέ-) Od. 6.19: fut. κείσομαι Il. 18.121, A. Ch. 895, etc., Dor. κεισεῦμαι Theoc. 3.53. (Cf. Skt. śéte ( = κεῖται), also śáyate ‘lie’, Gr. κοίτη, κοιμάομαι, perh. Lat. cunae, etc.):—

children.definition: to be laid (used as Pass. to τίθημι): hence, lie, lie outstretched, used by Hom. mostly with Preps., πυρὴν . . ᾗ ἔνι κεῖται Πάτροκλος Il. 23.210; κεῖτο παρὰ μνηστῇ ἀλόχῳ 9.556; ἐπὶ γαίῃ 11.162; ὑπʼ αἰθούσῃ Od. 21.390; also ἐπί τινος, ὀστέα . . κείμενʼ ἐπʼ ἠπείρου 1.162; τὸ δʼ ἥμισυ κεῖτʼ ἐπὶ γαίης Il. 13.565, cf. 20.345; but ὁ δʼ ἐπʼ ἐννέα κεῖτο πέλεθρα lay stretched over . . , Od. 11.577, al.; later κεῖσθαι εἰς . . , in pregnant sense, εἰς ἀνάγκην κείμεθʼ E. IT 620; εἰς ὀλίγην κ. κόνιν AP 9.677 ( Agath.); also ἐπὶ τὴν ὁδὸν κ. to be strewn upon the path, Call. Iamb. 1.250: Archit., κείμενον σχῆμα, opp. ὠρθωμένον, plan, opp. elevation, Apollod. Poliorc. 163.3: c.acc., τόπον . . ὅντινα κεῖται S. Ph. 145 (anap.).

data.quote: ἐπί τινος, ὀστέα . . κείμενʼ ἐπʼ ἠπείρου
τὸ δʼ ἥμισυ κεῖτʼ ἐπὶ γαίης

children.definition: lie down to rest, repose, Od. 13.281, etc.; πορφυρέᾳ κείμενος ἐν χλανίδι Simon. 37.12; lie, remain, κεῖτο γὰρ ἐν νήεσσι . . Ἀχιλλεύς Il. 2.688, cf. 7.230, etc.; οὐ χρῆν ἥσυχον κεῖσθαι πόδα S. Fr. 142.13; lie still, λασίην ὑπὸ γαστέρʼ ἐλυσθεὶς κείμην, of Odysseus under the ramʼs belly, Od. 9.434: metaph., κακὸν κείμενον a sleeping evil, S. OC 510 (lyr.); τοῦ κύματος κειμένου Ael. NA 15.5.

lie sick or wounded, ἐν νήσῳ κεῖτο, of Philoctetes, Il. 2.721, cf. 15.240; κείσεται οὐτηθείς 8.537, cf. 11.659; γήραϊ λυγρῷ κεῖται ἐνὶ μεγάροις ἀρημένος 18.435; κεῖτʼ ὀλιγηπελέων Od. 5.457; lie in misery, ἐοικότι κεῖται ὀλέθρῳ 1.46; κεῖται ἐν ἄλγεσι θυμός 21.88, cf. S. Ph. 183 (lyr.); κ. ἐν κακοῖς E. Ph. 1639, Hec. 969; κειμένῳ ἐπεμπηδᾶν to kick him when heʼs down, Ar. Nu. 550.

data.quote: γήραϊ λυγρῷ κεῖται ἐνὶ μεγάροις ἀρημένος

children.definition: lie dead, Il. 5.467, 16.541, al., A. Ag. 1438, 1446, S. Ph. 359; κεῖται δὲ νεκρὸς περὶ νεκρῷ Id. Ant. 1240: rare in Prose, χίλιοι . . νεκροὶ κείμενοι Hdt. 8.25, cf. Hdn. 2.1.8.

children.label: b
children.definition: lie buried, τῇδε κείμεθα Simon. 92, cf. 97; κεῖσαι ζῶν ἔτι μᾶλλον τῶν ὑπὸ γᾶς Id. 60; also κ. ἐν Ταρ τάρῳ Pi. P. 1.15; ἐν τάφῳ, ἐν Ἅιδου, παρʼ Ἅιδῃ, A. Ch. 895, S. El. 463, OT 972; also in Prose, τὸν χῶρον ἐν τῷ κέοιτο Ὀρέστης Hdt. 1.67, cf. 4.11, 9.105, Th. 2.43; κ.ὑπό τινων to be buried by . . , Plu. Gen.Socr. 2.583c.

data.quote: κεῖσαι ζῶν ἔτι μᾶλλον τῶν ὑπὸ γᾶς
τὸν χῶρον ἐν τῷ κέοιτο Ὀρέστης

children.definition: lie unburied, Il. 18.338, 19.32; κεῖται . . νέκυς ἄκλαυτος ἄθαπτος 22.386; μὴ δή με ἕλωρ Δαναοῖσιν ἐάσῃς κεῖσθαι 5.685; also κεῖτʼ ἀπόθεστος . . ἐν πολλῇ κόπρῳ lay uncared for, of the old hound of Odysseus, Od. 17.296; εὐνὴ . . κάκʼ ἀράχνια κεῖται ἔχουσα 16.35; of places, lie in ruins, δόμοι . . χαμαιπετεῖς ἔκεισθʼ ἀεί A. Ch. 964 (lyr.), cf. Pl. R. 425a, Lyc. 252.

data.quote: μὴ δή με ἕλωρ Δαναοῖσιν ἐάσῃς κεῖσθαι

children.definition: have a fall, A. Eu. 590; πεσών γε κείσομαι Ar. Nu. 126.

children.label: II
children.definition: to be situated, lie, νῆσος ἀπόπροθεν εἰν ἁλὶ κεῖται Od. 7.244, cf. 9.25, 10.196, etc.; ἐν τῇ [γῇ] κείμενά ἐστι τὰ Σοῦσα (for κεῖται) Hdt. 5.49; Αἴγινα . . πρὸς νότου κ. πνοάς A. Fr. 404; πρὸ Μεγάρων κ. Th. 3.51; πόλις αὐτάρκη θέσιν κειμένη Id. 1.37; θέσιν κέεσθαι νοσερωτάτην Hp. Aër. 6, cf. Arist. HA 496a14; κ. πρὸς τὸν ἥλιον, πρὸς ἄρκτον, Id. Mete. 360b14, 363a3.

lie or be in a place, ὅθι οἱ φίλα δέμνιʼ ἔκειτο Od. 8.277; ἕλε δίφρον κείμενον placed there, 17.331, cf. 410; φόρμιγγα . . , ἥ που κεῖται ἐν ἡμετέροισι δόμοισι 8.255: in Prose, δύο τράπεζαι ἐκείσθην Lys. 13.37; χύτρας εὐκρινῶς κειμένας X. Oec. 8.19.

data.quote: φόρμιγγα . . , ἥ που κεῖται ἐν ἡμετέροισι δόμοισι

children.definition: fit, of shoes, Herod. 7.121.
κεῖσθαι, posture, attitude, as a category, Arist. Cat. 2a2.

children.label: III
children.definition: to be laid up, in store, of goods, property, etc., δόμοις ἐν κτήματα κεῖται Il. 9.382; πολλὰ δʼ ἐν ἀφνειοῦ πατρὸς κειμήλια κ. 6.47; βασιλῆϊ δὲ κεῖται ἄγαλμα is reserved . . , 4.144; μνῆμα ξείνοιο . . κέσκετʼ ἐνὶ μεγάροισι was left lying . . , Od. 21.41; of things dedicated to a god, κ. ἐν θησαυρῷ Hdt. 1.51, cf. 52, Alc. 94; of money, κείμενα deposits, Hdt. 6.86.αʹ; κ. σοι εὐεργεσία ἐν τῷ ἡμετέρῳ οἴκῳ Th. 1.129, cf. SIG 22.15 (Epist. Darei), Pl. R. 345a; πολλὰ χρήματα ἐπὶ τῇ τούτου τραπέζῃ κεῖταί μοι at his bank, Isoc. 17.44; παρά τινι Pl. Ep. 346c; τἀργύριόν σοι κείσεται the caution-money shall be deposited, Ar. Ra. 624; δραχ μὴν ὑπόθες.—Answ. κεῖται πάλαι Diph. 73.2: metaph., εἰ ταῦτʼ ἀνατὶ τῇδε κείσεται κράτη shall be placed to her credit, S. Ant. 485, cf. Pi. I. 5(4).18.

data.quote: πολλὰ δʼ ἐν ἀφνειοῦ πατρὸς κειμήλια κ.
κ. σοι εὐεργεσία ἐν τῷ ἡμετέρῳ οἴκῳ

children.label: IV
children.definition: to be placed in position, τῶν ἐπὶ τοῦ τοίχου . . κειμένων κιόνων IG 1(2).372.46.

data.quote: τῶν ἐπὶ τοῦ τοίχου . . κειμένων κιόνων

children.definition: to be set up, ordained, ἄεθλα κεῖτʼ ἐν ἀγῶνι Il. 23.273, cf. Hdt. 8.26, 93, Th. 2.46; ὅπλων ἔκειτʼ ἀγὼν πέρι S. Aj. 936 (lyr.).

κεῖται νόμος the law is laid down, E. Hec. 292; νόμοι ἐπʼ ὠφελίᾳ τῶν ἀδικουμένων κεῖνται Th. 2.37; νόμοι κεῖνται περί τινος Antipho 6.2 ; οἱ νόμοι οἱ κείμενοι the established laws, Ar. Pl. 914, cf. Lys. 1.48, etc.; οἱ ὑπὸ τῶν θεῶν κείμενοι νόμοι X. Mem. 4.4.21; οἱ νόμοι οἱ ὑπὸ οἱ τῶν βασιλέων κείμενοι Isoc. 1.36, cf. D. 24.62; καινὰ κεῖσθαι θέσμιʼ ἀνθρώποις E. Med. 494; αἱ κείμεναι ὑπὸ τῶν ὑπατικῶν γνῶμαι the votes given by . . , D.H. 7.47; οὐκέτι κ. ἡ διαθήκη no longer holds, Is. 6.32; so of philosophical arguments, hold good, κατά τινων Phld. Rh. 1.51 S.; θάνατος ὧν κεῖται πέρι E. Ion 750; κείμεναι ζημίαι Lys. 14.9, cf. Th. 3.45.

data.quote: νόμοι ἐπʼ ὠφελίᾳ τῶν ἀδικουμένων κεῖνται
οἱ ὑπὸ τῶν θεῶν κείμενοι νόμοι
οἱ νόμοι οἱ ὑπὸ οἱ τῶν βασιλέων κείμενοι

children.definition: to be laid down in argument, posited, assumed, τοῦτο ἡμῖν οὕτω κείσθω Pl. R. 350d, etc.; ὡμολογημένον ἡμῖν κ. Id. Plt. 300e; freq. in Arist., κείσθω let it be assumed, APr. 34b23, al.; τὸ ἐξ ἀρχῆς κείμενον the assumption, Metaph. 1008b2, 1047b10 (pl.); τὰ περὶ τὴν διάνοιαν ἐν τοῖς περὶ ῥητορικῆς κ. Po. 1456a35.

data.quote: τὰ περὶ τὴν διάνοιαν ἐν τοῖς περὶ ῥητορικῆς κ.

children.definition: οὔνομα κεῖται the name is given, Hdt. 4.184, 7.200, cf. X. Cyr. 2.2.12, Pl. Sph. 257c, etc.; ὑπὸ τοῦ πατρὸς κείμενον [ὄνομα] Is. 3.32; κεῖσθαι without ὄνομα, Pl. Cra. 392d; κείμενα ὀόματα established terms, Arist. Top. 140a3, Demetr. Eloc. 96.
πάντα δεινὰ κἀπικινδύνως βροτοῖς κεῖται, παθεῖν μὲν εὖ, παθεῖν δὲ θάτερα danger is set before men, that they may . . , S. Ph. 503.

children.label: V
children.definition: ἐνὶ φρεσὶ πένθος ἔκειτο lay heavy, Od. 24.423; εὔστομα κείσθω remain unspoken, Hdt. 2.171; νεῖκος ἔκειτό τισι there was an enduring feud, S. OT 491 (lyr.); Ἑλλήνων κείσομαι ἐν στόματι my name shall be a household word, AP 9.62 ( Even.); πολλῶν κείμενος ἐν στόμασιν Thgn. 240; εὖ κείμενα A. Ch. 693; μὴ κινεῖν (sc. κακὸν) εὖ κείμενον ‘let sleeping dogs lie’, Pl. Phlb. 15c, cf. Hyp. Fr. 30, Suid.
ταῦτα θεῶν ἐν γούνασι κεῖται, i.e. these things are yet in the power of the gods, to give or not, Il. 17.514, 20.435.

κεῖσθαι ἔν τινι to rest entirely or be dependent on him, ἐν ἀγαθοῖσι κ. πολίων κυβερνάσιες Pi. P. 10.71; ἐν ὔμμι ὡς θεῷ κείμεθα S. OC 248 (lyr.); also ἐπί τινι, τὰ δʼ οὐκ ἐπʼ ἀνδράσι κ. Pi. P. 8.76: also with simple dat., Λεωφίλῳ πάντα κεῖται Archil. 69, prob. in Com.Adesp. 1325; of things, depend upon, τὸ πανηγυρικὸν ἐν μελέτῃ καὶ τριβῇ κ. Phld. Rh. 1.93 S.; τὰ . . γυμνάσια ἐν τῇ κινήσει κ. Antyll. ap. Orib. 6.23.1.

data.quote: ἐπί τινι, τὰ δʼ οὐκ ἐπʼ ἀνδράσι κ.
τὸ πανηγυρικὸν ἐν μελέτῃ καὶ τριβῇ κ.
τὰ . . γυμνάσια ἐν τῇ κινήσει κ.

children.definition: to be left to settle, of urine, Hp. Epid. 1.4.2 [1.26.βʹ].

children.label: b
children.definition: φάρυγξ οὐ φλεγμαίνουσα, κειμένη δέ, i.e. not swollen, ib. 2.2.24.

data.quote: φάρυγξ οὐ φλεγμαίνουσα, κειμένη δέ, i.e. not swollen, ib.

children.definition: to be found, occur, παρὰ τῷ ποιητῃ Str. 7.3.6, cf. Ath. 2.58b; κεῖται ἐν τῷ Περὶ Πλούτου Phld. Oec. p.39 J.; ποῦ κεῖται; Ath. 4.165d, cf. Κειτούκειτος; κ. ἀντί τινος to be used instead of . . , Str. 8.6.7; τὸ κείμενον the received text, Sch.vulg. Pi. O. 2.48.
treasurer, Just. Nou. 40 Praef. 1.
treasury, Cod.Just. 11.48.20.1, al.

anything stored up as valuable, treasure, heirloom, τῆ νῦν, καὶ σοὶ τοῦτο, γέρον, κ. ἔστω Il. 23.618, cf. Xenoph. 2.9, etc.; δῶρον . . ὅ τοι κ. ἔσται Od. 1.312; ἐν ἀφνειοῦ πατρὸς κ. κεῖται, χαλκός τε χρυσός τε πολύκμητός τε σίδηρος Il. 6.47; opp. live chattels ( πρόβασις), Od. 2.75 (pl.), S. El. 438, E. Heracl. 591; of a person, Id. Rh. 654; of a fish, κ. Ἀμφιτρίτης Theoc. 21.55: metaph., κ. ἐσθλά. of γνῶμαι, E. Fr. 362.4: rare in Prose, Hdt. 3.41, Luc. Prom.Es 4, PGiss. 35.2 (iii A.D.): metaph., φίλος ἀνυπόστατον κ. Secund. Sent. 11; in bad sense, κακὸν κ. Hp. Lex 4.

data.quote: τῆ νῦν, καὶ σοὶ τοῦτο, γέρον, κ. ἔστω
ἐν ἀφνειοῦ πατρὸς κ. κεῖται, χαλκός τε χρυσός τε πολύκμητός τε σίδηρος

children.label: II
children.definition: relic, ἅγια κ. τῆς ἐκκλησίας PGrenf. 2.111.1 (v/vi A.D.).
treasured up, πατὴρ . . ὅτῳ καὶ μήτηρ . . ἐν οἰκίᾳ κεῖνται κειμήλιοι Pl. Lg. 931a; κειμήλιον θέσθαι [τὸν θησαυρόν] ib. 913a.

data.quote: πατὴρ . . ὅτῳ καὶ μήτηρ . . ἐν οἰκίᾳ κεῖνται κειμήλιοι

children.definition: treasury, Just. Nov. 59.6.
treasure up, Eust. 1376.13:— Med., Hdn. Epim. 66.

definition: κεῖνος, η, ο, Ion. and poet. for ἐκεῖνος. Adv. κείνως.
κεινός, ή, όν, Ion. and poet. for κενός. κεινόω, v. κενόω.
Κεῖος, v. Κέως. κεῖρα· γενεά, ἢ ἡλικία, Hsch.

children.definition: shorn, LXX Je. 31 ( 48). 31, 36; prob. f.l. for κουράς, v.l. κιδάρας.
girth of a bedstead, Ar. Av. 816, LXX Pr. 7.16, Plu. Alc. 16.

children.label: II
children.definition: swathing-band, bandage, written κηρία, PMed.Lond. 155 IV10, 28, al., Sor. 1.83, 2.59, 61, Hsch. (- ρεί-); καιρία (q. v.); κιρία, PCair.Zen. 69.9, 11, PSI 4.341.7, 387.4 (iii B.C.); grave-clothes, in form κειρίαι (v.l. κηρίαι) Ev.Jo. 11.44.

children.label: III
children.definition: κηρίαι, tapeworms, Hp. ap. Erot.; κειρίαι Gal. 14.755.
taeniosus, Gloss.
swathe, in Pass., Herm.Trism. in Rev.Phil. 32.254, 264.
ἱέραξ or ἀλκυών, Hsch., cf. Verg. Ciris tit.

definition: κείρω, fut. κερῶ Pl. R. 471a, Ion. κερέω Il. 23.146: aor. ἔκειρα Pi. P. 9.37, E. Tr. 1173, etc., Ep. ἔκερσα Il. 13.546 ( ἀπο-, in tmesi), A. Supp. 666 (lyr.): pf. κέκαρκα Sammelb. 6002 (ii B.C.), ( περι-) Luc. Symp. 32:— Med., fut. κεροῦμαι E. Tr. 1183, ( ἀπο-) Pl. Phd. 89b: aor. ἐκειράμην Lys. 2.60, etc., Ep. ἐκερσάμην Call. Fr. 311, A. Pers. 953 (lyr.): — Pass., aor. 1 part. κερθείς ( v.l. καρθ-) Pi. P. 4.82: aor. 2 ἐκάρην [ᾰ] PSI 4.368.45 (iii B.C.), subj. κᾰρῇ Hdt. 4.127, inf. κᾰρῆναι, part. καρείς, Luc. Sol. 6, Plu. Lys. 1: pf. inf. κεκάρθαι Hdt. 2.36: Att. plpf. ἐκεκάρμην Luc. Lex. 5. (Cf. Skt. kṛṇá̄ti ‘wound’, Lat. caro: prob. also OE. scieran, Eng. shear.):—

children.definition: cut short, shear, clip, esp. of hair, σοί τε κόμην κερέειν (sc. Σπερχειῷ) Il. 23.146, cf. Paus. 1.37.3; κ. ἐν χρ [τὰς τρίχας] crop it close, Hdt. 4.175; ἀλόχων κείραντες ἔθειραν E. Hel. 1124 (lyr.): —more freq. in Med., cut off oneʼs hair or have it cut off, as a sign of mourning (cf. κουρά) , τοῦτο . . γέρας οἶον ὀϊζυροῖσι βροτοῖσι, κείρασθαί τε κόμην βαλέειν τʼ ἀπὸ δάκρυ παρειῶν Od. 4.198, cf. 24.46, Il. 23.46; πολύν σοι βοστρύχων πλόκαμον κεροῦμαι E. Tr. 1183; κείρομαι κόμαν Id. Ph. 322 (lyr.): abs., cut off oneʼs hair, κείρασθε, συμπενθήσατʼ Id. HF 1390; ἐφʼ οἷς ἡ πόλις ἐπένθησε καὶ ἐκείρατο Aeschin. 3.211, etc.; ἄξιον ἦν ἐπὶ τῷδε τῷ τάφῳ κείρασθαι τῇ Ἑλλάδι Lys. l.c.: Com., πρὸς φθεῖρα κείρασθαι to have oneself close shorn, Eub. 32:— Pass., κουρᾷ . . πενθίμῳ κεκαρμένος E. Or. 458; σύμβολον κ. half- cropped, Hermipp. 14; τὰ ῥόδα κ. Pherecr. 108.29; also, of the hair, to be cut off, πλόκαμοι κερθέντες Pi. P. 4.82; βοστρύχους κεκαρμένους E. El. 515.

data.quote: τοῦτο . . γέρας οἶον ὀϊζυροῖσι βροτοῖσι, κείρασθαί τε κόμην βαλέειν τʼ ἀπὸ δάκρυ παρειῶν
ἐφʼ οἷς ἡ πόλις ἐπένθησε καὶ ἐκείρατο
ἄξιον ἦν ἐπὶ τῷδε τῷ τάφῳ κείρασθαι τῇ Ἑλλάδι

children.definition: crop a person, σφέας αὐτοὺς καὶ τοὺς ἵππους, in sign of mourning, Hdt. 9.24; κεκάρθαι τὰς κεφαλάς to have their heads shorn, Id. 2.36; Θρᾳκιστὶ κέκαρμαι Theoc. 14.46; v. χρώς I.2, ἐγκυτί; shear sheep, μάχαιραι κουρίδες, αἷς κείρομεν τὰ πρόβατα καὶ τοὺς ποιμένας Cratin. 37; κείρεσθαί ( tonderi) μου τὰ πρόβατα, ἀλλʼ οὐκ ἀποξύρεσθαι ( deglubi) βούλομαι Tiber. ap. D.C. 57.10 (cf. infr. 3); τὸ μὲν [καρῆναι] ἐπὶ προβάτων τιθέασι καὶ ἐπὶ ἀτίμου κουρᾶς (cf. Luc. Sol. 6), κείρασθαι δὲ ἐπὶ ἀνθρώπων Phryn. 292; but τῶν Ἀργείων ἐπὶ πένθει καρέντων Plu. l.c.; τῷ σε χρὴ δρεπάνοισι καὶ οὐ ψαλίδεσσι καρῆναι AP 11.368 ( Jul. Antec.).

data.quote: μάχαιραι κουρίδες, αἷς κείρομεν τὰ πρόβατα καὶ τοὺς ποιμένας
τῷ σε χρὴ δρεπάνοισι καὶ οὐ ψαλίδεσσι καρῆναι

children.definition: fleece’, plunder, τὴν μάμμην Herod. 3.39.

children.label: II
children.definition: cut down, δοῦρʼ ἐλάτης κέρσαντες Il. 24.450; ὕλην S. Tr. 1196; crop close, opp. ἐπιτέμνειν, Thphr. CP 3.23.3; pluck, ἄνθη Philostr. VA 1.5: metaph., ἐκ λεχέων κ. μελιαδέα ποίαν Pi. P. 9.37; Ἄρης κέρσειεν ἄωτον A. Supp. 666 (lyr.).

ravage a country, esp. by cutting down crops and fruit-trees, τὸ πεδίον Hdt. 5.63; τέμενος Id. 6.75, cf. OGI 765.10 ( Priene); τὴν γῆν Hdt. 6.99, Th. 1.64; χώραν Aen.Tact. 15.9; destroy, πόλιν Call. Fr. 1.60 P.; also, clear, of pioneers, ὄρος Hdt. 7.131:— Pass., of a country, to be ravaged, καρῆναι Id. 4.127, cf. 8.65; κεκαρμένα κτήματα SIG 364.67 ( Ephesus, iii B.C.):— Med., χθὼν πεύκας κειραμένη having its pine-trees cut down, AP 9.106 ( Leon.); ἄρουραι λήϊα κειράμεναι Ps.-Phoc. 166: metaph., Σπάρτη . . ἐκείρατο δόξαν had her glory shorn off, Epigr. ap. Paus. 9.15.6; Ἄρης νυχίαν πλάκα κερσάμενος having had the plain swept clean (by destroying the men), A. Pers. 953 (lyr.).
ἔκειρε πολύκερων φόνον slaughtered many a horned beast by hewing, S. Aj. 55.
hew, carve, ἐπίβασιν Inscr.Cypr. 99 H.
cut through transversely, opp. σχίζειν (slit longitudinally), φλέβα Antyll. ap. Orib. 7.11.3.

children.label: III
children.definition: destroy, consume:

tear, eat greedily, of beasts, κείρει τʼ εἰσελθὼν βαθὺ λήϊον [ὄνος] Il. 11.560; of fish, δημὸν . . ἐπινεφρίδιον κείροντες 21.204; of vultures, ἧπαρ ἔκειρον Od. 11.578, cf. Luc. DDeor. 5[1].1, DMort. 24[30].1.
waste, devour, ἐκείρετε πολλὰ καὶ ἐσθλὰ κτήματʼ ἐμά Od. 2.312; ἔκειρον κτήματʼ ἐνὶ μεγάρῳ 22.369, etc.: abs., κείρετε (sc. βίοτον) 1.378.

data.quote: ἐκείρετε πολλὰ καὶ ἐσθλὰ κτήματʼ ἐμά

definition: κεῖσε, Adv., Ion. and Ep. for ἐκεῖσε. κεισός, a plant, Hsch. (Perh. for κισσός.) κεῖσσα, Lacon. for κίσσα, Id. κείστη, v. κίστη.
Κειτούκειτος, ὁ, comic name of a Gramm., who asked respecting every dish— κεῖται ἢ οὐ κεῖται; (cf. κεῖμαι V.5) Ath. 1.1e.
κείω (A), once in Hom. κέω (v. infr., cf. A.D. Adv. 143.11), Ep. Desiderat. of κεῖμαι, βῆ δʼ ἴμεναι κείων he went

children.definition: to lie down, went to bed, Od. 14.532, cf. 18.428; ἔνθʼ ἴομεν κείοντες Il. 14.340; κείω I will lie, Od. 19.340; κειέμεν οὕτω that they will lie thus, 8.315; ὄρσο κέων get thee to bed, 7.342.
sleep, rest, Arat. 1009.
cleave, radic. form of κεάζω, only in pres. part. κείων (perh. for *κεῶν = *κεάων) Od. 14.425.
Hsch.
κεκαδήσομαι, v. κήδω:—for κεκαδδίχθαι, v. κάδδιχος. κεκαδμένος, v. καίνυμαι.
maliciously, Sch. Aeschin. 3.3.

definition: κεκάλακας καλὴ γέγονας, ἢ ἐκάλεσας, Hsch. κεκαλμένον· ἐπὶ γῆς ἐκπεπτωκός, Id. κέκασμαι, κεκασμένος, κέκαστο, v. καίνυμαι.
κεκαφηώς, Ep. pf. part. with no pres. in use, Hom. only in phrase κεκαφηότα θυμόν

children.definition: breathing forth oneʼs life, Il. 5.698, Od. 5.468: in later Poets intr., worn out, fordone, κεκαφηότα γυῖα Opp. C. 4.206; κ. γυῖα κεραυνῷ Nonn. D. 2.539; δέμας κ. λιμῷ ib. 26.108; δίψῃ κεκαφηότας ib. 29.299; ἄνδρα . . κεκαφηότα δηϊοτῆτι ib. 46.93; κεκαφηότι θυμῷ Opp. H. 3.572; κ. ταρσῷ weary, AP 9.653 ( Agath.). (Cogn. with καπύω, κάπτω: Hsch. has κέκηφε· τέθνηκεν.)

definition: κεκεῖνα κισσός, Hsch. κεκῆνας· λαγωούς (Cret.), Id.

children.definition: notoriously, Poll. 6.208.
effeminately, Anon. ap. Suid. s.v. ληκυθισμός.
κέκλετο, v. κέλομαι. κέκληγα, part. κεκληγώς, v. κλάζω. κεκλίᾰται, κεκλῐμένος, κέκλῐτο, v. κλίνω. κέκλομαι, κεκλόμενος, v. κέλομαι. κέκλῠθι, κεκλῠτε, v. κλύω.
wearily, Sch. S. El. 164.

definition: κεκμηώς, ότος and ῶτος, Ep. pf. part. Act. of κάμνω. κέκνακεν· ὑπὸ κακῶν ἀπειρήκει, Hsch.

children.definition: modestly, regularly, Ath. 6.273d, Ael. NA 2.11, 6.1.
to satiety, gloss on ἄδην, EM 16.42.
modestly, Ael. NA 2.11, Philostr. VA 7.42, Jul. Mis. 344d.
κεκράανται, κεκράαντο, v. κραίνω.
scream, cry, Ar. Pax 637 (pl.).

definition: κεκραγμός, ὁ, = foreg., E. IA 1357, Plu. QConv. 2.654f (pl.).

children.definition: bawler, Hp. Morb.Sacr. 15, Ar. Eq. 137, Luc. JTr. 33.
in a mixed manner, πρὸ τῶν ἀμίκτων ἐλέγχων κ. παρέχεται τοῖς ἐπαίνοις αὐτούς Procl. in Alc. p.102 C.

data.quote: πρὸ τῶν ἀμίκτων ἐλέγχων κ. παρέχεται τοῖς ἐπαίνοις αὐτούς

children.definition: with well-blended colours, Plu. Alex. fort. 2.335a (fort. leg. κεκριμένως).

definition: κεκραξιδάμας [ δᾰ], αντος, ὁ, ( κέκραγα, δαμάω) coined by Ar. V. 596 (by analogy to Ἀλκιδάμας) as epith. of Cleon,

children.definition: he who conquers all in bawling.
in a masterly manner, ἀποδεδωκέναι Hipparch. 1.8.11, cf. Phld. Po. 5.26, 29.
vigorously, v.l. in D.H. Comp. 25.
positively, S.E. M. 11.42.
judiciously, discreetly, μουσικῇ χρῆσθαι Plu. Mus. 2.1142c; cf. κεκραμένως.
elaborately, of style, D.H. Comp. 25 (v.l. κεκρατημένως).

Cecrops mythical king of Athens, Hdt. 8.44; represented with a serpentʼs tail, and hence called διφυής, Sch. Ar. V. 436; with the tail of a θυννίς, Eup. 156: pl., = Κεκροπίδαι, IG 3.1335. ( Κέκροψ a barbarian name acc. to Hecat. 119 J.)

children.label: II
children.definition: Adj. Κεκρόπιος, α, ον, Cecropian, Athenian, πέτρα K. the Acropolis, E. Ion 936 (also simply Κεκροπία, ἡ, used for Athens itself, Supp. 658, El. 1289); K. χθών Attica, Id. Hipp. 34, etc.; Κεκρόπιοι, οἱ, the Athenians, APl. 16.295: Κεκροπία, ἡ, village-community in Early Attica, Str. 9.1.20: Κεκρόπιον, τό, shrine of Cecrops, IG 1(2).372.63:—also Κεκροπ-ικός, ib. 374.144.
Κεκροπίς, ίδος, φυλή Ar. Av. 1407, IG 1(2).302.59, etc.; K. αἶα AP 7.81 (Antip. Sid.).
Κεκροπίδαι, οἱ, descendants of Cecrops, Athenians, Hdt. l.c., etc.: in sg., Ar. Eq. 1055.
Adv. Κεκροπίᾱθεν, Ep. Κεκροπί-ηθεν, from Athens, Call. Dian. 227, A.R. 1.95.
secretly, LXX Je. 13.17, Arr. Epict. 3.7.11.

definition: κεκρυφάλιον [ ᾰ], τό, Dim. of κεκρύφαλος, Poll. 7.179.

children.label: II
children.definition: κεκρυφάλεος· ἀριστερόν ( Aeol.), AB 1095.
netting κεκρύφαλοι (v. sq. [κεκρύφαλος]), Critias 69 D.

womanʼs hair-net, τῆλε δʼ ἀπὸ κρατὸς βάλε δέσματα σιγαλόεντα, ἄμπυκα, κεκρύφαλόν τε ἰδὲ πλεκτὴν ἀναδέσμην Il. 22.469, cf. Hp. Steril. 219, Ar. Th. 138, D.H. 7.9; κ. καὶ μίτρα Ar. Th. 257; λιθόβλητοι, λιθοκόλλητοι κ., AP 5.269 ( Paul.Sil.), 275 ( Agath.).

data.quote: τῆλε δʼ ἀπὸ κρατὸς βάλε δέσματα σιγαλόεντα, ἄμπυκα, κεκρύφαλόν τε ἰδὲ πλεκτὴν ἀναδέσμην

children.definition: part of the head-stall of a bridle, X. Eq. 6.8; ἱππικὸς κ. IG 2(2).1388.74, cf. Poll. 1.184, 10.55.

children.label: II
children.definition: second stomach of ruminating animals, from its net-like structure, Arist. HA 507b4, PA 674b14, Ael. NA 5.41.

children.label: III
children.definition: pouch or belly of a hunting-net, X. Cyn. 6.7, Plu. Alex. 25. [ ῠ in Hom., AP; but ῡ in Att., Ar. l.c., Eup. 170, Antiph. 117, 189.]
κέκτικε· τέτοκεν, Hsch. κεκύθωσι [ῠ], v. κεύθω. κεκύκη· καμπύλη, Id. κέκυλτα· δῶρα τὰ τῇ χειρὶ ἑλκόμενα, Id.

definition: Κεκυπώσιος, ὁ (sc. μήν), name of month at Zelea, SIG 279.17 (iv B.C.).

children.definition: sounding, noisy, Ζέφυρος Il. 23.208; Ἄρτεμις 16.183 ( παρὰ τὸν γιγνόμενον ἐν τοῖς κυνηγίοις κέλαδον Sch. ad loc.); and so κελαδεινή alone, Il. 21.511; of Dionysus, AP 9.524.11; αὐλῶνες h.Merc. 95; σῦριγξ Opp. H. 5.455: neut. pl. as Adv., ποταμοὶ κελαδεινὰ ῥέοντες A.R. 3.532:— Pi. has Aeol. form κελαδεννός, ἔπεα κ. high-sounding verses, P. 3.113; ὀμφά Pae. 5.46; κ. Χάριτες the loud-voiced Charites, P. 9.89; κ. ὕβρις noisy insult, I. 4(3).8.

definition: κελαδέω, Sapph. 4, E. IT 1093 (lyr.); 3 pl. - έοντι Pi. P. 2.15: fut. - ήσω Terp. 5, Pi. O. 2.2, E. HF 694 (lyr.), - ήσομαι Pi. O. 10(11).79: poet. aor. κελάδησα B. 15.12, A. Ch. 609 (lyr.), E. Hel. 371 (lyr.): ( κέλαδος):— Ep. and Lyr. (Trag. and Com. only in lyr. and anap., exc. Theopomp.Com. 40: late in Prose, Aq. Is. 49.13, Philostr. VA 6.17, Ps.-Luc. Philopatr. 3) Verb (cf. κελάδω),

children.definition: sound as flowing water, ὔδωρ ψῦχρον κ. Sapph. l.c.; κῦμα κελαδοῦν Orac. ap. Aeschin. 3.112.

shout aloud, ἀτὰρ κελάδησαν Ἀχαιοί, in applause, Il. 23.869; ἐμὲ δεῖ κ. Pratin. Lyr. 1.3, cf. B. l.c.; κελαδέοντι ἀμφὶ Κινύραν φᾶμαι Pi. P. 2.15: c. acc. cogn., κ. ὕμνους Terp. 5, cf. Pi. N. 4.16 codd.; νόμον Id. Pae. 2.101; ἁδυμελῆ κόσμον κ. Id. O. 11(10).14; [ βοάς], παιᾶνας, E. Ion 93, HF l.c.

cries, e.g. of a new-born babe, A. Ch. 609; of the swallow, Ar. Pax 801, Ra. 684; of the grasshopper, Theopomp.Com. l.c.; of the cock, ἐξ εὐνᾶς κ. crows from his perch, Theoc. 18.57; of bells, ring, tinkle, E. Rh. 384; of the flute, κ. φθόγγον κάλλιστον Id. El. 716; of the sea, Ar. Th. 44.

children.label: II
children.definition: sing of, celebrate loudly, τινα Pi. O. 1.9, 2.2, 6.88, E. IT 1093, Ar. Ra. 1527; τέμενος B. 13.21, cf. E. Tr. 121; τινὰ ἀμφʼ ἀρετᾷ Pi. P. 2.63.
rushing sound, Ζεφύρου E. Ph. 213 (lyr.); ποταμῶν Ar. Nu. 283 (anap.); later, of any loud sound, κ. σάλπιγγος AP 6.350 ( Crin.).
loud-sounding, γλῶσσα Pi. N. 4.86.
rushing amid the noise of the chase, epith. of Artemis, Orph. A. 902.
a noise as of rushing waters: generally, loud noise, din, clamour, θῆκε πολὺν κέλαδον καὶ ἀϋτήν, of persons quarrelling, Il. 9.547, cf. 18.530, Od. 18.402; κ. Εὐίου E. Ba. 578 (lyr.).
musical sound, κ. λύρας Id. IT 1129 (lyr.), cf. Cyc. 489 (anap.).

children.label: II
children.definition: loud clear voice, as of an oracle, Pi. P. 4.60; shout, cry, κ. οὐ παιώνιος A. Pers. 605, cf. 388, Ch. 341 (anap.), S. El. 737, etc.
chirp of the τέττιξ, Ael. NA 1.20; of the twittering of birds, κ. παντομιγής Lyr.Alex.Adesp. 7.6.

definition: κελάδω, Ep. form of κελαδέω, used in part. only,

children.definition: sounding, πὰρ ποταμὸν κελάδοντα Il. 18.576, cf. B. 8.65, Posidipp. ap. Tz. H. 7.661; πλῆτο ῥόος κ. Il. 21.16, cf. Theoc. 17.92; Ζέφυρον κελάδοντʼ ἐπὶ οἴνοπα πόντον Od. 2.421; πόντον κ. Ar. Nu. 284 (anap.); Βορέης κ. Q.S. 8.243.
with black ( i.e. bloody) spear, Pi. N. 10.84.
black with clouds, Homeric epith. of Zeus, shrouded in dark clouds, cloud-wrapped, παρὰ πατρὶ κελαινεφεῖ Il. 21.520, cf. Pi. Pae. 6.55; addressed as κελαινεφές in Il. 15.46, Od. 13.147.
dark-coloured, ῥέε δʼ αἷμα κ. 11.36, cf. Il. 4.140; πεδίον κ. black, rich soil, Pi. P. 4.52; σκότος κ. Id. Fr. 142.
to be black, in Ep. 3 pl. κελαινιόωσι, Opp. H. 4.67; part. κελαινιόων Nonn. D. 38.18.
black and bloody with gnawing, ἧπαρ A. Pr. 1025.
with dark skin).
grow black or dark, A. Ch. 413 (lyr.).
with black skin or hide, Opp. H. 5.18, Nonn. D. 15.158: pl. κελαινόρῑνες S. Fr. 29.

black, dark, freq. in Hom., αἷμα Il. 1.303, Od. 16.441; νύξ Il. 5.310, etc.; κῦμα 9.6; λαῖλαψ 11.747; χθών 16.384; δέρμα 6.117; ἦτορ Hes. Sc. 429: ὄμβρος Emp. 111.6; κ. φῦλον a swarthy race, of the Ethiopians, A. Pr. 808; Ἔπαφος ib. 851; ξίφη, λόγχα, S. Aj. 231, Tr. 856 (both lyr.), cf. E. Ba. 628 (troch., prob. from the colour of the metal rather than black with blood-stains); of things on which the sun does not shine, esp. of the nether world, dark, murky, A. Pr. 433 (lyr.); Ἐρινύες Id. Ag. 462 (lyr.); Στύξ Lyc. 706; κ. θῖνα, of the bottom of the sea, S. Ant. 590 (lyr.); λύει κ. βλέφαρα suffers her eyes to close in darkness, ib. 1302: great, mighty, δίψα Lyc. 1425. (Cf. Skt. kalaṅkas ‘spotʼ: κηλίς may be cogn.)
black-gleaming, ὄρφνα κ. murky twilight, Ar. Ra. 1331 (lyr.).
black-hearted, μήτηρ A. Eu. 459.
black-coloured, σίλφη AP 9.251 ( Even.), prob. l. in A. Supp. 785 (lyr.): also κελαινό-χροος, ον, Man. 4.261.
black-faced: hence, gloomy, θυμός S. Aj. 955 (lyr.):—fem. κελαιν-ῶπις νεφέλα Pi. P. 1.7:—also κελαιν-ωπός, ή, όν, Hdn. Gr. 1.188.
swarthy, Κόλχοι Pi. P. 4.212.

definition: κελαρύζω, fut. - ύσομαι or - ύξομαι prob. in Hsch. (- ύζεται· μετὰ ποιᾶς φωνῆς ἠχήσει cod.): aor. κελάρυξε Lyr.Adesp. 90.1; Poet. and late Prose (v. infr.):—

children.definition: babble, murmur, of running water, κατειβόμενον κελαρύζει Il. 21.261, cf. Theoc. 7.137, Phld. Po.Herc. 994.14, Philostr. VA 1.16, Im. 1.21; later, of a rushing torrent, c. acc. cogn., ὣς ποταμὸς κ. μέγας . . σμερδαλέον μύκημα Opp. C. 2.145; also, gush out like water, ἀπὸ δʼ ἕλκεος . . αἷμα μέλαν κελάρυζε Il. 11.813; [ ἅλμη] ἀπὸ κρατὸς κελάρυζεν ran gushing, Od. 5.323; of milk, Lyr.Adesp. l.c.

data.quote: ὣς ποταμὸς κ. μέγας . . σμερδαλέον μύκημα
ἀπὸ δʼ ἕλκεος . . αἷμα μέλαν κελάρυζε

children.definition: pour with a gush or gurgling sound, ἀφύσσοντες οἶνον κελαρύζετε Ion Trag. 10 (lyr.). (Onomatopoeic, acc. to Str. 14.2.28, Plu. QConv. 2.747d.)
rushing sound, as of water, Hsch.

definition: κελάρυσμα, ατος, τό, = foreg., Opp. C. 4.325.
κελέβειον, Ion. κελέβ-ήϊον, τό, Dim. of sq., Antim. 17.
κελέβη, ἡ ( ποτηρίου εἶδος θερμηροῦ καὶ ποιμενικὸν ἀγγεῖον, Hsch.),

children.definition: cup, jar, Anacr. 42, Theoc. 2.2, Euph. 8, Call. Fr.anon. 34 ( Aeol., acc. to Clitarch. and Silen. ap. Ath. 11.475c).

definition: κελεβρά λεπτὰ καὶ νεκρὰ κτήνη, Hsch. κελεΐς· ἀξίνη, Id. κελένδρυον ( -υνον Id.), τό,

children.definition: oaken beam, derived from κελέων, δρῦς by Id., Phot. (who glosses it by κιχήσιππον).
the vertical beams in the upright loom, between which the web hung down, Ar. Fr. 795, Antipho Fr. 11, Theoc. 18.34, Ant.Lib. 10.2, cf. Paus.Gr.and Ael.Dion. Fr. 228: sg., v. foreg.
green woodpecker, Picus viridis, Arist. HA 593a8, 610a9.

definition: κελέτρα, ἡ, dub. sens. in IG 9(2).521.26, 33 ( Larissa, iii B.C.).
κέλετρον ᾧ τοὺς ἰχθύας θηρῶσιν ἐν τοῖς ποταμοῖς, Hsch.

children.definition: belonging to the road, δαίμονες Hsch.: κελεύθειᾰ, epith. of Athena at Sparta, Paus. 3.12.4.
wayfarer, AP 6.120 ( Leon.: prob. - ίτης).
road-making, A. Eu. 13.
wayfarer, AP 7.337.

definition: κέλευθος, ἡ, with poet.heterocl.pl. κέλευθα; poet. Noun (also Arc., IG 5(2).3.23 ( Tegea, iv B.C.)),

children.definition: road, path, not common in lit. sense, πολλαὶ γὰρ ἀνὰ στρατόν εἰσι κέλευθοι Il. 10.66; Ἰσθμία κ. B. 17.17; ἐν κελεύθοις in the streets, A. Ch. 349 (lyr.); ἐγγὺς γὰρ νυκτός τε καὶ ἤματός εἰσι κέλευθοι Od. 10.86, cf. Parm. 1.11; ἀνέμων κέλευθα or κέλευθοι, Il. 14.17, Od. 5.383, etc.; ὑγρὰ, ἰχθυόεντα κ., of the sea, 3.71, 177; ἁλὸς βαθεῖαν (vel - είας) κ. Pi. P. 5.88; ἄρκτου στροφάδες κ. paths, orbits, S. Tr. 131 (lyr.), cf. E. Hel. 343 (lyr.); θεῶν δʼ ἀπόεικε κελεύθου withdraw from the path of the gods, Il. 3.406 (v.l. ἀπόειπε κελεύθους): metaph., ἔργων κέλευθον ἂν καθαράν on the open road of action, Pi. I. 5(4).23, cf. O. 6.23; στείχει διʼ εὐρείας κ. μυρία παντᾷ φάτις B. 8.47; ἔστι μοι μυρία παντᾷ κ. Pi. I. 4(3).1, cf. B. 5.31: Πειθοῦς, Δίκας κ., Parm. 4.4, B. 10.26.

data.quote: πολλαὶ γὰρ ἀνὰ στρατόν εἰσι κέλευθοι
ἐγγὺς γὰρ νυκτός τε καὶ ἤματός εἰσι κέλευθοι
στείχει διʼ εὐρείας κ. μυρία παντᾷ φάτις

children.label: II
children.definition: journey, voyage, by land or water, ὅς κέν τοι εἴπῃσιν ὁδὸν καὶ μέτρα κελεύθου Od. 4.389; οὐκ ἄν πω χάζοντο κελεύθου would not have halted from their onward way, Il. 11.504, cf. 12.262; πολλὰ κ. a far journey, i.e. a great distance, S. OC 164 (lyr.).

data.quote: ὅς κέν τοι εἴπῃσιν ὁδὸν καὶ μέτρα κελεύθου

children.definition: expedition, A. Ag. 127 (lyr.), Pers. 758 (troch.).

children.label: III
children.definition: way of going, walk, gait, μιμήσομαι λύκου κ. E. Rh. 212; διʼ ἀψόφου βαίνων κ. Id. Tr. 888.

children.label: IV
children.definition: way of life, ἀργαλέας βιότοιο κ. Emp. 115.8; κ. ἁπλόαι ζωᾶς Pi. N. 8.35; τὰν ἀνόστιμον βίου κ. E. HF 433 (lyr.).

command, Plu. Aud.poet. 2.32c (pl.), Plot. 4.8.2: freq. in Inscrr. and Pap., κατὰ κέλευσιν θεοῦ OGI 589 ( Syria), cf. 455.3 ( Aphrodisias, i B.C.), BGU 286.9 (iv A.D.), etc.; ἐκ κελεύσεώς τινος IGRom. 4.214 ( Ilium, iii/iv A.D.); ἀπὸ κ. CIG 5187b3 ( Ptolemais, v/vi A.D.).

definition: κέλευσμα or κέλ-ευμα (v. infr.), ατος, τό, ( κελεύω)

children.definition: order, command, A. Eu. 235, S. Ant. 1219 (pl.), etc.; call, summons, A. Ch. 751 (pl.): in Prose, word of command in battle, Hdt. 4.141, 7.16, cf. E. Hec. 929 (lyr.); ὁ Κύριος ἐν κ. καταβήσεται ἀπʼ οὐρανοῦ 1 Ep.Thess. 4.16; also, the call of the κελευστής (q.v.), which gave the time to the rowers, ἀπὸ ἑνὸς κελεύσματος all at once, Th. 2.92, D.S. 3.15; ἐξ ἑνὸς κελεύματος Sophr. 25; ἐκ κελεύματος at the word of command, A. Pers. 397, cf. E. IT 1405; καχάζετε . . ἀπὸ κ. Eub. 8; στρατεύσονται ἀφʼ ἑνὸς κ. LXX Pr. 30.27; of the boatswainʼs pipe, κέλευσμα προσαυλεῖν Phld. Mus. p.15 K.; also, the call of the driver to his horses, κελεύματι μόνον καὶ λόγῳ ἡνιοχεῖται Pl. Phdr. 253d; of the huntsman to his hounds, X. Cyn. 6.20; κ. κυνηγετῶν S. Ichn. 225. ( κέλευμα is the more ancient form, as in A. Pers. 397, Ch. 751, S., Sophr., Pl. (codd. l.c.), X., ll.cc., v.l. in Hdt. ll. cc., Th. l.c.)

data.quote: ὁ Κύριος ἐν κ. καταβήσεται ἀπʼ οὐρανοῦ

children.definition: by way of command, Eust. 1080.63.
order, command, E. IA 1130, Cyc. 653 (pl.).

definition: κελευσμοσύνη, ἡ, Ion. for κελευσμός, κέλευσμα, Hdt. 1.157.

children.definition: one must order, Gal. 17(2).171.
boatswain, who gives the time to the rowers, E. Hel. 1576, Ar. Ach. 554, Th. 2.84, X. HG 5.1.8, Pl. Alc. 1.125c, Phld. Rh. 1.361 S., D.S. 20.50, Arr. Fr. 151 J.
hortatory: κελευστική (sc. τέχνη), Pl. Plt. 260e; τοῦ ψόγου τὸ κ. Plu. Adul. 2.72d (s.v.l.).
ordered, commanded, Luc. Vit.Auct. 8.

definition: κέλευστρα or κελεύστα· ἅμαξα ἡμιονική, Hsch.

children.definition: one who commands, more general than κελευστής, Phryn. PS p.81 B.

definition: κελευτιάω, Frequentat. of κελεύω, only in Ep. part., Αἴαντε κελευτιόωντʼ ἐπὶ πύργων πάντοσε φοιτήτην

children.definition: continually urging on [the men], Il. 12.265; -όων γαιήοχος ὦρσεν Ἀχαιούς 13.125 (v.l. κελευθιόων, = ὁδηγῶν, Sch. ad loc.; κελευστιόων Hsch.).

definition: κελεύω, Ep. impf. κέλευον Il. 23.767: fut. κελεύ-σω, Ep. inf. -σέμεναι Od. 4.274: aor. ἐκέλευσα, Ep. κέλ- Il. 20.4: pf. κεκέλευκα Lys. 1.34, Luc. Demon. 44:— Med., aor. ἐκελευσάμην Hp. Nat.Puer. 13: more freq. in compds. δια-, ἐπι-, παρα-κελεύομαι (q.v.):— Pass., fut. - ευσθήσομαι D.C. 68.9: aor. ἐκελεύσθην Hdt. 7.9.αʹ, S. OC 738, Th. 7.70: pf. κεκέλευσμαι X. Cyr. 8.3.14, Luc. Sacr. 11: plpf. ἐκεκέλευστο D.C. 78.4 ( ἐκελεύθην v.l. in Hdt. 7.9.αʹ, and κεκέλευμαι IG 2(2).1121.13 (iv A.D.), v.l. in App. BC 5.141 are later forms). (A lengthd. form of κέλομαι, q.v.):—

children.definition: urge, drive on, [ ἵππους] ὁ γέρων ἐφέπων μάστιγι κέλευε . . κατὰ ἄστυ Il. 24.326: hence, exhort, bid,

data.quote: ἵππους] ὁ γέρων ἐφέπων μάστιγι κέλευε . . κατὰ ἄστυ

children.definition: inf., order one to do, σʼ ἔγωγε . . κελεύω ἐς πληθὺν ἰέναι 17.30, cf. 2.11, al., Hdt. 1.8, 24, etc.; ἐκέλευσε τὸν παῖδα περιμεῖναί ἑ κελεῦσαι he bade the lad bid us to wait for him, Pl. R. 327b; ὁ νόμος τὸν ἐπιβουλεύσαντα κελεύει φονέα εἶναι, i.e. bids that he be held guilty, Antipho 4.2.5; ὁ τὸν νόμον κελεύων ἄρχειν δοκεῖ κελεύειν ἄρχειν τὸν θεὸν καὶ τὸν νοῦν Arist. Pol. 1287a29; ἐς τὴν Μίλητον ἔπεμπον κελεύοντες σφίσι τὸν Ἀστύοχον βοηθεῖν Th. 8.38; request, Lys. 16.16; opp. ἐπιτάττειν, IG 1(2).76.33.

data.quote: σʼ ἔγωγε . . κελεύω ἐς πληθὺν ἰέναι
ὁ τὸν νόμον κελεύων ἄρχειν δοκεῖ κελεύειν ἄρχειν τὸν θεὸν καὶ τὸν νοῦν
ἐς τὴν Μίλητον ἔπεμπον κελεύοντες σφίσι τὸν Ἀστύοχον βοηθεῖν

children.definition: σφῶϊ μὲν οὔ τι κελεύω Il. 4.286; τά με θυμὸς . . κελεύει (sc. εἰπεῖν) 7.68, etc.: with inf. subjoined, τί με ταῦτα κελεύεις . . μάχεσθαι; 20.87.

εἰ μὴ θυμός με κελεύοι (sc. φείδεσθαι) Od. 9.278; ὥς με κελεύεις (sc. μυθεῖσθαι) 11.507: in Prose, ἐκέλευσε τοὺς ἕνδεκα ἐπὶ τὸν Θηραμένην ordered them [to go] against him, ordered them to seize him, X. HG 2.3.54; κ. τινὰς ἐπὶ τὰ ὅπλα ib. 20:— Pass., receive orders, Arist. Pol. 1253b34.

ὃ μὴ κελεύσαι Ζεύς ( Herm. for - σει) A. Eu. 618; ὁ νόμος τὰ μὲν κελεύων τὰ δʼ ἀπαγορεύων Arist. EN 1129b24:— Pass., τὸ κελευόμενον commands, orders, Hdt. 7.16, Antipho Soph. 61, X. Cyr. 4.1.3: pl., Pl. R. 340a.

data.quote: ὁ νόμος τὰ μὲν κελεύων τὰ δʼ ἀπαγορεύων

children.definition: inf., urge or order one to do, κηρύκεσσι . . κέλευσε κηρύσσειν . . Il. 2.50, Od. 2.6, etc.; ἀλλήλοισι κέλευον ἅπτεσθαι νηῶν . . Il. 2.151; ἑτάροισι . . ἐκέλευσα ἐμβαλέειν Od. 9.488: in later Prose, D.S. 19.17, Ceb. 32.4 codd., Luc. DMort. 1.1, Phalar. Ep. 121.1, etc.
τί δʼ ἐστὶν ὃ κελεύεις ἐμοί; Men. Pk. 224, cf. Ael. NA 9.1.
ἵπποισι καὶ Αὐτομέδοντι κελεύσας Il. 16.684; cf.infr. ΙΙΙ.
Hom., ὡς σὺ κελεύεις Il. 23.96, al.; λέξω, κελεύεις γάρ A. Ch. 107; κελεύων, opp. αὐτοχειρίῃ, Democr. 260; κελευούσης τῆς Πυθίης Hdt. 6.36; κελεύοντος καὶ δεομένου Lys. 5.1.
inf. only, σιγᾶν κελεύω I order silence, S. Ph. 865; οὐκ ἂν κελεύσαιμʼ εὐσεβεῖν Id. Ant. 731; recommend, propose, Lys. 12.25, D. 4.21, etc.; opp. οὐκ ἐάω, Hdt. 6.109, X. Ath. 2.18.

children.label: II
children.definition: urge, entreat, Il. 24.599, Od. 10.17, Hdt. 1.116.

children.label: III
children.definition: give time to rowers, c.dat., Pl. R. 396b: abs., Ath. 12.535d.
sing a chanty, S.E. M. 6.24.
Gloss.; ποιεῖ κελεφούς lepers, Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(4).189; cf. κελυφοκομῖον.

definition: κέληξ, ὁ, = sq., IG 5(1).213 ( Sparta, v B.C.).

children.definition: courser, riding-horse, Ὀδυσσεὺς ἀμφʼ ἑνὶ δούρατι βαῖνε, κέληθʼ ὡς ἵππον ἐλαύνων bestrode one plank, as if riding on a horse, Od. 5.371 ( κ. ἵππος also in later Prose, SIG 314 A 7,36, al. (Arc., iv B.C.), Plu. Alex. 3, Paus. 6.14.4); κ. καὶ ἅρματα Hdt. 7.86; ἵππον κέλητʼ ἀσκοῦντα Eup. 152; κέλης κέλητα παρακελητιεῖ Ar. Pax 901; freq. in the titles of Pindarʼs Odes, as O. 1; νίκας Πυθοῖ καὶ Ἰσθμοῖ καὶ Νεμέᾳ τεθρίπποις τε καὶ κέλησι Pl. Ly. 205c, cf. Plin. HN 34.19; κ. πωλικός, τέλειος, IG 2.966.

data.quote: νίκας Πυθοῖ καὶ Ἰσθμοῖ καὶ Νεμέᾳ τεθρίπποις τε καὶ κέλησι

children.label: II
children.definition: fast-sailing yacht with one bank of oars, Hdt. 8.94, Th. 4.9, 8.38, X. HG 1.6.36, Ephipp. 5.17 (anap.), Plb. 5.94.8, Plin. HN 7.208, etc.

children.label: III
children.definition: Ar. Lys. 60; so ἥρως Κέλης Pl.Com. 174.18.
pudenda muliebria, Eust. 1539.34.
ride, ἵπποισι κελητίζειν ἐῢ εἰδώς, of one who leaps from horse to horse, Il. 15.679.

children.label: II
children.definition: Ar. V. 501, Th. 153, Macho ap. Ath. 13.577d.
Dim. of κέλης II, Th. 1.53, 4.120, App. BC 2.56.
= Lat. cella, room, chamber, POxy. 1128.15 (ii A.D.), etc.

definition: κελλαρίδιον, τό, Dim. of κελλάριον, Sammelb. 4292 (written κελαρίδιν).

children.definition: wine delivered to a landlordʼs cellar, PSI 8.953.73 (vi A.D.):—sg.
store-chamber, Stud.Pal. 20.75 ii 9 (iii/iv A.D.).
cupboard for glasses, κ. τριλάγυνον POxy. 741.12 (ii A.D.), PLond. 2.191.9 (ii A.D.); store-chamber, POxy. 1851 (vi A.D.).
cellarman, Wien.Stud. 24.131 (ii A.D.).

definition: κελλαρίτης [ ῑ], ου, ὁ, = foreg., Stud.Pal. 20.107.4 (iv A.D.), PKlein.Form. 40 (vi A.D.).

children.definition: portable table, PRyl. 136.10 (i A.D.); cf. Lat. cilibantum, cilliba.
cellarman, butler, PSI 8.955.13 (vi A.D.).

definition: κελλίον, τό, Dim. of κέλλα, PAmh. 2.152.16 (v/vi A.D.);

children.definition: garret, AP 11.351 ( Pall.).

definition: κελλίων ἡ τῶν ὅλων φύσις, Hsch. κελλόν· στρεβλόν, πλάγιον, Id.
κέλλω, poet. (exc. D.H. 14.1 as etym. of Κελτική), = Prose ὀκέλλω: fut. κέλσω A. Supp. 331, E. Hec. 1057 (lyr.), κελῶ Hsch.: aor. ἔκελσα (v. infr.):—

children.definition: drive on, Hom. only in Od., always in phrase νῆα κέλσαι run a ship to land, put her to shore, νῆα μὲν αὐτοῦ κέλσαι Od. 10.511; νῆα . . ἐκέλσαμεν ἐν ψαμάθοισιν 9.546; cause to land, ἀνδρῶν ἡρώων στόλον A.R. 2.1090: metaph., Ἄργει κ. πόδα E. El. 139 (lyr.).

children.label: II
children.definition: put to shore or into harbour, κελσάσῃσι δὲ νηυσὶ καθείλομεν ἱστία Od. 9.149; κέλσαντες Σιμόεντος ἐπʼ ἀκτάς A. Ag. 696 (lyr.), cf. Eu. 10; ἐς Ἄργος Id. Supp. 331; πρὸς γῆν S. Tr. 804: c.acc. loci, κέλσαι . . Ἄργους γαῖαν A. Supp. 15 (anap.); Τροίας ἄστυ E. Rh. 934: metaph., A. Pr. 186 (lyr.); κ. ποτὶ τέρμα E. Hipp. 140 (lyr.); πᾷ κέλσω; where shall I find a haven? Id. Hec. 1057 (lyr.). (Cf. κέλομαι.)

definition: Κέλμις, name of an Idaean Dactyl, also glossed by παῖς ἢ λύκιθον (sic), Hsch. [accent changed]
κελοί, οἱ, = τὰ ξύλα, Hsch. s.v. κελέοντας.
